gold_answer: "Aquagenic maladies" could be a pediatric form of the aquagenic urticaria.

pred_answer: Yes. The authors found that the manic/mixed episode distinction in bipolar disorder patients runs true over time.
gold_answer: These data suggest a pattern of diagnostic stability over time for manic and mixed episodes in patients with bipolar disorder. Careful prospective studies of this issue are needed.

pred_answer: No. The associations between birth characteristics and intellectual performance were not explained by socioeconomic factors in adolescence or familial effects.
gold_answer: We found that all of the studied dimensions of restricted fetal growth are independently associated with increased risks of low intellectual performance and that these associations are only partly mediated by socioeconomic or familial factors.

pred_answer: No. Atropine is associated with a higher incidence of hypersalivation and rash, and a lower incidence of vomiting. The benefits of atropine do not outweigh its risks.
gold_answer: Ketamine sedation was successful and well tolerated in all cases. The use of atropine as an adjunct for intramuscular ketamine sedation in children significantly reduces hypersalivation and may lower the incidence of post-procedural vomiting. Atropine is associated with a higher incidence of a transient rash. No serious adverse events were noted.

pred_answer: Continuity of care is an important aspect of surgical training. Our results suggest that there is a significant gap between the ideal of complete continuity of care and the reality of the current system. We believe that the current system is not conducive to the development of a comprehensive understanding of the patient's disease process and its management. We
gold_answer: The continuity-of-care experiences of vascular trainees are suboptimal. This is especially true for postoperative clinic assessment. Same-day admission surgery accounted for most of the cases and was associated with the poorest continuity of care. To provide complete surgical training in an era of changing therapeutic modalities and same-day admission surgery, vascular programs must be creative in structuring training to include adequate ambulatory experience.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: ACS is common in patients with SCD who present with fever and was grossly underestimated by evaluating physicians. History and physical examination appear to be of little value in defining which febrile patients require CXR. In view of the mortality and morbidity associated with ACS, empiric CXR should be considered when evaluating a febrile patient with SCD.

pred_answer: No. Desflurane does not alter left ventricular function when used to control surgical stimulation during aortic surgery.
gold_answer: This study demonstrates that in patients at risk for cardiac morbidity undergoing vascular surgery, desflurane is effective to control intraoperative hypertension without fear of major cardiac depressant effect.

pred_answer: In alcohol-intoxicated trauma patients, a negative physical examination and absence of major chest injury may obviate the need for CT scan of the abdomen.
gold_answer: The incidence of abdominal injury in intoxicated, hemodynamically stable, blunt trauma patients with a normal abdominal examination and normal mentation is low. Physical examination and attention to clinical risk factors allow accurate abdominal evaluation without CT.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that substance use may be an important factor in the development of HIV-related sexual risk behaviors among US high school students.
gold_answer: HIV prevention programs for youth should recognize that substance use may be an important indicator of risk for HIV infection and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome through its association with unsafe sexual behaviors.

pred_answer: The present study provides evidence that acupuncture can be effective in treating phonotraumatic vocal pathologies.
gold_answer: The findings showed that acupuncture of voice-related acupoints could bring about improvement in vocal function and healing of vocal fold lesions.

pred_answer: The Hawkins sign is a good predictor of necrosis in fractures of the neck of the astragalus.
gold_answer: A positive Hawkins sign rules out that the fractured talus has developed avascular necrosis, but its absence does not confirm it.

pred_answer: The cup-cage construct provides initial stability in THA for osteoporotic acetabular fractures. However, the contact surface achieved between the acetabular component and the ilium and ischium is small. This may explain the high rate of early loosening seen in this series.
gold_answer: The majority of acetabular components in this cohort were stable despite the small contact surface achieved between the component and pelvic bone. Three of 10 migrated in excess of the limits that predict later loosening in primary THA but it remains to be seen whether these limits apply to this selected group of frail osteoporotic patients. We continue to use this technique routinely to treat patients with the same indications, but since the analysis of these data we have added screw fixation of the acetabular component to the ischial tuberosity and the superior pubic ramus.

pred_answer: Level of trauma center appears to impact mortality in severely injured trauma patients. Further research is required to determine if this finding is generalizable to other trauma systems.
gold_answer: Severely injured patients treated at a level III center had a higher mortality rate than those treated at a level I center. Most problems identified occurred in the emergency department and were related to delays in care provision. This research highlights the importance of efficient prehospital, in-hospital, and regional trauma systems, performance monitoring, peer review, and adherence to protocols and guidelines.

pred_answer: Holmium:YAG laser lithotripsy is an effective method for treating ureteral stones.
gold_answer: The Holmium:YAG laser is an ideal intracorporeal lithotripter for ureteral calculi, with a high success rate and low morbidity.

pred_answer: Residents' CT ordering practices may change if they are educated about the potential effects of radiation exposure.
gold_answer: Most clinicians did not change their CT scan ordering after receiving education about radiation from a radiologist. Radiation education allowed clinicians to discuss CT benefits and risks with their patients and to choose appropriate CT protocols. Referring physician groups are interested in this topic, and radiologists should be encouraged to give radiation lectures to them.

pred_answer: No. The long-term results of the TERPT are not equal to those of the ABD pull-through. The continence score was significantly better in the ABD group, and the stool pattern score was better in the TERPT group.
gold_answer: Our long-term study showed significantly better (2-fold) results regarding the continence score for the abdominal approach compared with the transanal pull-through. The stool pattern and enterocolitis scores were somewhat better for the TERPT group. These findings raise an important issue about the current surgical management of HD; however, more cases will need to be studied before a definitive conclusion can be drawn.

pred_answer: No. The odds of reporting unsafe sex did not change significantly over time.
gold_answer: There was no evidence of a trend in unsafe sex behaviour over time. However, several subgroups were identified as being more likely to report unsafe sex and should be targeted for specific interventions.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of quantitative real-time PCR for BCRABL transcripts can be correlated between laboratories when the same positive control cell line and quality control gene are used.
gold_answer: These results suggest that quantitative real-time PCR assays for BCRABL detection can be comparable between laboratories despite significant differences in methodologies if the same positive control cell line and quality control gene are used. It is imperative that some level of assay standardization be adopted between laboratories, not only for patients who are monitored at different facilities, but also for larger investigative studies in which hematologic, cytogenetic and molecular responses are to be compared.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that telmisartan can prevent hepatic fibrosis in rats with alloxan-induced diabetes. This effect may be related to the inhibition of TGF-beta expression in the liver.
gold_answer: Results suggest that telmisartan may reduce type-I diabetes mellitus-induced hepatic injury by suppressing activated hepatic stellate cells through concomitant TGF-beta1 down-regulation.

pred_answer: The results suggest that treadmill training may have secondary benefits for people in the chronic stage of recovery from stroke.
gold_answer: A task-specific intervention designed to improve gait speed may potentially provide secondary benefits by positively impacting depression, mobility and social participation for people post stroke.

pred_answer: The incidence of colon cancer was lower in patients treated with bezafibrate than in those receiving placebo. This finding suggests that bezafibrate may have a preventive effect on the development of colon cancer.
gold_answer: Our data, derived from patients with coronary artery disease, support the hypothesis regarding a possible preventive effect of bezafibrate on the development of colon cancer.

pred_answer: The incidence of GBS carriers among pregnant women in the western Galilee in Israel is high. The rate of GBS carriers is higher in Arab women than in Jewish women. The rate of GBS carriers does not differ significantly between women in early and late pregnancy.
gold_answer: In the present study we found a significant increase in the incidence of GBS colonization in pregnant women in northern Israel. We also found an increased rate of GBS carriers in Arab women relative to Jewish women.

pred_answer: Women who deliver within 1 week of AC have a high risk of delivering at<34 weeks. Women who deliver at>or = 34 weeks after AC may have been candidates for rescue AC.
gold_answer: Rescue AC may apply to only 18% of cases, and we identified subsets of more likely candidates.

pred_answer: Yes. We have demonstrated that it is safe and effective to treat a contralateral hydrocele in neonatal testicular torsion solely through a scrotal approach.
gold_answer: We have demonstrated that approaching a contralateral hydrocele in cases of neonatal testicular torsion solely through a scrotal incision is safe and effective. Inguinal exploration was not performed in our study and our long-term results demonstrate that such an approach would have brought no additional benefit. In avoiding an inguinal approach we did not subject our patients to unnecessary risk of testicular or vasal injury. Contralateral hydrocele is commonly seen in cases of neonatal testicular torsion. In our experience this is a condition of minimal clinical significance and does not warrant formal inguinal exploration for treatment. This conservative management strategy minimizes the potential of contralateral spermatic cord injury in the neonate. The aims of the study were met.

pred_answer: Symptoms are common in smokers with and without COPD. Smoking history and spirometry are needed to identify those at risk for COPD.
gold_answer: COPD is underdiagnosed in the United States. Symptoms are frequent in subjects with AO and increase their risk for COPD, but add little beyond age and smoking history to the predictive value of spirometry. In view of the high prevalence of symptoms and their poor predictive value, a simpler and more effective approach would be to screen older smokers.

pred_answer: The combination of chloroquine and cyclosporine results in synergistic suppression of T-cell responses to MiHC and MHC. The mechanism of this synergy may involve the ability of chloroquine to inhibit antigen presentation by antigen-presenting cells.
gold_answer: Lysosomotropic amines in combination with cyclosporine appear to be synergistic in the suppression of T-cell proliferation to MiHC and MHC. Use of chloroquine in combination with cyclosporine may result in improved control of GVHD.

pred_answer: Ultrasound examination is a useful tool in the staging of squamous cell carcinoma of the penis. It can be used to assess the extent of the disease and the invasion into the corpora. The technique is noninvasive, easy to perform, and inexpensive. However, it has some limitations, such as the inability to
gold_answer: While ultrasound examination is inexpensive and easily done, it is not accurate enough for staging small penile cancers located at the glans penis. However, for larger tumors ultrasound can be a useful addition to physical examination by delineating reliably the anatomic relations of the tumor to structures such as the tunica albuginea, corpus cavernosum, and urethra.

pred_answer: Unanswerable.
gold_answer: The incidence of CPM is not increased in IVF/ICSI pregnancies compared with spontaneous conceptions. CPM probably does not account for the adverse perinatal outcomes following IVF/ICSI.

pred_answer: Yes. The first ACR is a strong predictor of adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes, independent of other prognostic factors.
gold_answer: ACR is an independent prognostic factor for maternal and neonatal adverse outcomes in suspected preeclampsia. ACR may be useful to inform risk predictions within a prognostic model.

pred_answer: No. In a controlled feeding study, AA women did not require fewer calories than non-AA women to maintain weight.
gold_answer: These results do not support the view that AA women are at greater risk for obesity because they require fewer calories to maintain weight.

pred_answer: The presence of metastases in regional lymph nodes correlates with the downregulation of TCR zeta, especially in CD8(+) T cells. The number of myeloid CD11c(+) dendritic cells is reduced in the LN of patients with LN metastases. These findings suggest that the condition of
gold_answer: The preliminary results of this study suggest that this approach may be helpful as an independent tumor staging factor. It is also worth noting that part of the staging process could also be based on features describing the immune cells in the peripheral blood.

pred_answer: The results suggest that a febrile reaction to PLTs may increase the risk of alloimmunization to RBCs. This finding may have implications for the management of patients who experience a febrile reaction to PLTs.
gold_answer: These preliminary data support our hypothesis that recipient inflammation may affect RBC alloimmunization in humans; however, a more detailed understanding of the pathophysiologic association between inflammation and alloimmunization is required before definitive conclusions can be reached.

pred_answer: The rate of virologic relapse in patients with HBeAg-negative CHB who discontinued treatment with NAs is high. Therefore, it is not possible to stop treatment with NAs in these patients.
gold_answer: The results suggest that NA treatment can be stopped in selected patients with CHB as long as they are not cirrhotic, have completed a minimum period of treatment, have normal ALT and sustained undetectable DNA. These patients should be closely monitored during the first year and then indefinitely.

pred_answer: In patients with rectal cancer threatening or affecting the prostatic plane, preoperative chemoradiotherapy is associated with a low rate of CRM infiltration and a low incidence of local recurrence. Partial prostatectomy after preoperative chemoradiotherapy is oncologically safe, but intra-operative urethral damage occurs frequently.
gold_answer: Preoperative chemoradiation is mandatory in male patients with a threatened or affected anterior circumferential margin on preoperative MRI. In patients with preoperative prostatic infiltration, prostatic resection is necessary. In this group of patients partial prostatectomy seems to be oncologically safe.

pred_answer: Yes. DBE is a safe and effective method for evaluating the small bowel in a community setting.
gold_answer: DBE appears to be equally safe and effective when performed in the community setting as compared to a tertiary referral center with a comparable yield, efficacy, and complication rate.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: We suggest that regardless of family history, all children over 5 years should be screened for hyperlipidemia. Education about hyperlipidemia and precautions for its complications should be given to both children and families. The best and easiest way to reach children is to screen them at schools. School is also a good place for education of children about hyperlipidemia and risk factors.

pred_answer: Hypotension may be a trigger for myocardial ischaemia in patients with ischaemic heart disease.
gold_answer: In patients with ischaemic heart disease and hypotension, symptomatic and silent ischaemia occurred in a temporally causal relation with hypotension, particularly for diastolic pressures, suggesting that patients with coronary disease may be susceptible to ischaemic events incurred as a result of low blood pressure caused by excessive hypotensive drug treatment.

pred_answer: Severe hypoglycaemia is associated with increased risk of CV events.
gold_answer: Severe hypoglycaemia is associated with an increased risk for CV outcomes in people at high CV risk and dysglycaemia. Although allocation to insulin glargine vs. standard care was associated with an increased risk of severe and non-severe hypoglycaemia, the relative risk of CV outcomes with hypoglycaemia was lower with insulin glargine-based glucose-lowering therapy than with the standard glycaemic control. Trial Registration (ORIGIN ClinicalTrials.gov number NCT00069784).

pred_answer: The current findings suggest that updating emotional content in working memory is a depression-specific deficit.
gold_answer: The results indicate that difficulties removing irrelevant material from working memory might be unique to depression, and the ability to inhibit irrelevant information is relatively preserved in social anxiety disorder.

pred_answer: Mitral valve replacement is associated with higher mortality compared with mitral valve repair in patients with advanced dilated and ischemic cardiomyopathy.
gold_answer: In patients with advanced dilated and ischemic cardiomyopathy and severe functional MR, MV replacement is associated with higher in-hospital and late mortality compared with MV repair. Therefore, mitral repair should be preferred whenever possible in this clinical setting.

pred_answer: Knowledge of the SU goal is low among gout patients. This may be due to the lack of communication between prescribers and patients regarding the importance of achieving the SU goal.
gold_answer: There is a knowledge deficit regarding the SU treatment goal among gout patients receiving ULT, despite generally high levels of other gout-specific knowledge. SU goal information may be an important and underutilized concept among providers treating gout patients.

pred_answer: No. Government-funded, low-income vision care programs are available in Canada but are not sufficient to cover the cost of a general/routine eye examination and eyeglasses. These programs do not appear to improve utilization of eye care services by low-income individuals.
gold_answer: Despite government assistance, low-income individuals use vision care services less often than wealthy individuals.

pred_answer: No. The rate of early infection for TIVADs placed without antibiotic prophylaxis is low.
gold_answer: The rate of early infection without antibiotic prophylaxis before TIVAD placement in the interventional radiology suite is<1%. Based on these data, use of prophylactic antibiotics for TIVAD placement is not recommended.

pred_answer: Virtual planning and guided surgery can be considered economically viable if the time saved during surgery is sufficient to cover the additional costs of planning and cutting-guide production.
gold_answer: Even in capped health care systems, virtual planning and guided surgery including prebent or milled plates are financially viable.

pred_answer: In this study, starting insulin in type 2 diabetes with continued oral hypoglycemic agents was associated with less weight gain and fewer hypoglycemic events than starting insulin monotherapy.
gold_answer: Bedtime NPH insulin added to maximal therapy with sulfonylurea and metformin is an effective, simple, well-tolerated approach for patients with uncontrolled type 2 diabetes.

pred_answer: No. The nerve length irradiated did not correlate with pain relief.
gold_answer: Increasing the treatment volume to include a longer nerve length for trigeminal neuralgia radiosurgery does not significantly improve pain relief but may increase complications.

pred_answer: The main gate syndrome is a new format in mass casualty victim surge management. It is characterized by a massive number of victims arriving at the main gate of a trauma center, requiring a rapid triage and categorization process. This process should be performed by a team of experienced surgeons, who can also perform an initial ultrasound examination
gold_answer: Suicide bombing in crowded locations near an evacuation hospital may overwhelm the medical resources of the receiving center. It has been referred to as "The Main Gate Syndrome." We introduced the novel concept of a semi-evacuation hospital or receiving center where a second surgical triage was carried out. These exceptional circumstances require open-minded flexibility, a tailored approach, and close cooperation between surgeons and anesthetists to share experience, opinions, and ideas. In the setting of mass casualties, emergency ultrasound exam was shown to be a valuable and effective tool by virtue of its mobility, reproducibility, and immediate results.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: The present study does not support the recommendation of ultrasound as a conclusive diagnostic tool for internal derangements of the temporomandibular joint.

pred_answer: Yes. Our data suggest that a zero CLABSI rate can be achieved and sustained in the NICU.
gold_answer: High-quality training, strict compliance with evidence-based guidelines, and thorough documentation is associated with significant reductions in CLABSIs. Mindful organizing may lead to a better understanding of what goes into a unit's ability to handle peak demands and sustain extraordinary performance in the long-term.

pred_answer: No. The short gastric arteries are not reliable sources of arterial blood supply to the spleen after a spleen-preserving distal pancreatectomy with resection of the splenic vessels. The gastroepiploic arcade is the main arterial pathway feeding the spleen.
gold_answer: Experimental, intra- and postoperative instrumental investigations did not show the short gastric arteries to be engaged in the blood supply to the spleen after a spleen-preserving distal pancreatectomy with resection of the splenic vessels. In all cases, the left gastroepiploic artery was the main collateral vessel.

pred_answer: Yes. Short stay wards are an effective way of improving hospital efficiency and reducing costs.
gold_answer: This data demonstrates the robust nature of the short stay ward. At these two very different institutions we have shown improved bed efficient and patient care in a cost-effective way. We have also reported on greater parental satisfaction and early return of the child with their family to the community.

pred_answer: No. The rate of severe cervical lesions in patients with mild vaginal lesions was significantly lower than the rate of mild cervical lesions. The rate of "active" cervical lesions in patients with "active" vaginal lesions was significantly higher than the rate of "non active" cervical lesions in patients with "non active" vaginal lesions.
gold_answer: These data suggest that CIN and VAIN may have some common features in certain cases, i.e., if an HPV infection is proved.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that pre-eclampsia may be associated with hearing impairment. Further studies are needed to confirm our findings.
gold_answer: Pre-eclampsia is a potential risk factor for cochlear damage and sensorineural hearing loss. Further studies that include routine audiological examinations are needed in these patients.

pred_answer: Our study suggests that aripiprazole could be a new risk factor for pathological gambling. However, further studies are needed to confirm this hypothesis.
gold_answer: Adverse drug reactions were confronted with other already published case reports. Dopamine partial agonist mechanism of aripiprazole could explain the occurrence of pathological gambling.

pred_answer: No. The aggressive use of polyvalent antivenin for rattlesnake bites does not result in serious acute side effects.
gold_answer: The administration of polyvalent Crotalidae antivenin is safe. Acute hypersensitivity, when it occurs, consists solely in most cases of urticaria. Serious side effects are uncommon.

pred_answer: No. The weak association between serum ACE and SH in our study suggests that ACE is unlikely to be a useful marker for predicting the risk of SH in people with Type 1 diabetes.
gold_answer: The present survey showed a weak relationship between serum ACE and the frequency of SH, the clinical relevance of which is unclear. This limits the proposed role for serum ACE as an index of risk for SH.

pred_answer: Golytely is associated with a higher ADR compared to MiraLAX.
gold_answer: Golytely was more efficacious than MiraLAX in bowel cleansing, and was independently associated with both bowel prep quality (BBPS ≥ 7) and higher adenoma detection. Golytely should be used as first line for bowel prep for colonoscopy. Studies with larger populations are needed to confirm these results.

pred_answer: The present case suggests that SSDH may be a rare but possible complication after SAH.
gold_answer: Although the exact mechanism of SSDH in this case is unclear, we speculate that this SSDH was a hematoma that migrated from the intracranial subdural space. Low CSF pressure because of continuous drainage and intrathecal thrombolytic therapy may have played an important role in the migration of the hematoma through the spinal canal. It is important to recognize the SSDH as a possible complication of the SAH accompanied with intracranial subdural hematoma.

pred_answer: Survival in patients with type 1 HRS is poor. The ESLD etiology is an important prognostic factor. Urinary sodium concentration and serum creatinine at the initiation of therapy are independent prognostic factors.
gold_answer: We report for the first time ESLD etiology as a prognostic factor for survival. The renal function (expressed as serum creatinine) and urinary Na (<5 mEq/l) at the time of diagnosis were found to be associated with survival, suggesting that early treatment might increase survival.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that selection scores are a valid predictor of performance in the MRCGP examinations.
gold_answer: The general practice selection process is predictive of future performance in the MRCGP.

pred_answer: Yes. The Web-based sample reported higher psychological symptom burden compared to the clinic sample.
gold_answer: Our data have revealed a number of differences. Compared to the clinic sample, the Web-based sample had worse psychological symptom burden, younger average age, higher prevalence of employment, and a lower proportion on ART. For future research, we recommend that Web-based data collection should include the demographic variables that we note differed between samples. In addition, we recognize that each recruitment method may bring inherent sampling bias, with clinic populations differing by geographical location and reflecting those accessing regular medical care, and Web-based sampling recruiting those with greater Internet access and identifying survey materials through specific searches and contact with specific websites.

pred_answer: No. In our series, there was no evidence that cholecystectomy was an indication for concomitant splenectomy in mild HS.
gold_answer: The advice to perform a concomitant splenectomy in children with mild HS undergoing cholecystectomy for symptomatic gallstones needs revisiting. In the era of minimal access surgery, the need for splenectomy in such children should be judged on its own merits.

pred_answer: The use of LVADs as bridges to transplantation has been successful in our experience. The majority of patients have survived to transplantation, and the majority of those who have not have died of noncardiac causes. The use of LVADs as permanent devices is feasible, although the risk of infection and bleeding remains high.
gold_answer: Over all, our medium-term experience with implantable LVAD support is encouraging. Although additional areas of investigation exist, improvements in patients selection and management together with device alterations that have reduced the thromboembolic incidence and facilitated patient rehabilitation lead us to believe that a prospective, randomized trial is indicated to study the role that LVADs may have as an alternative to medical management.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study suggest that maternal FA use does not reduce the risk of heart anomalies in DS children.
gold_answer: Our study does not show a protective effect of FA on heart anomalies among infants with DS.

pred_answer: Yes. In our study, we found that ART patients face higher C-section rates during their stage of delivery.
gold_answer: Patients after ART treatment suffer from higher C-section rates during their stage of delivery.

pred_answer: The Ambu SIB provides adequate and safe manual inflations for infants up to 10 kg weight. The Neopuff T-piece resuscitator is not suitable for use in infants up to 10 kg weight.
gold_answer: The Ambu SIB was able to accurately deliver targeted pressures across all three models from preterm to infant. The Neopuff infant resuscitator was unable to deliver the targeted pressures in the infant model developing clinically significant levels of inadvertent PEEP which may pose risk during infant resuscitation.

pred_answer: No. The term "globulomaxillary cyst" is no longer used. However, the term "fissural cyst" is still used in the literature. In our opinion, the term "fissural cyst" should be abandoned because it does not reflect the true nature of these lesions. We propose the
gold_answer: According to the results of our study and the data from the international literature, the entity globulomaxillary cyst is no longer justified.

pred_answer: Patella position influences ligament balancing in total knee arthroplasty. Patella evertion may cause an increase in the lateral gap in knee flexion position. Patella subluxation may cause a decrease in the lateral gap in knee flexion position.
gold_answer: The gaps in patella eversion demonstrated smaller gaps both in knee extension and flexion position compared to the gaps of patella reduction position. The amount of decreased gaps was more definite in knee flexion position. Therefore, the intraoperative patellar positioning has influence on the measurement of the joint gap. Keeping the patella in reduced position is important during gap balancing.

pred_answer: We report the first nonfatal case of AFOP in a child. The association between VSAA and AFOP suggests that the latter may be the expression of immune dysregulation.
gold_answer: Aplastic anemia is associated with a variety of autoimmune syndromes. The sequence of events in our patient suggests that the hepatic failure, AFOP, and the VSAA may all have been part of an autoimmune syndrome. AFOP could be the result of immune dysregulation in this pediatric case with favorable outcome after immunosuppressive therapy and hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

pred_answer: In our series, the incidence of viable germ cell elements within the testicular remnant was low. We recommend that the testicular remnant be removed during the initial exploration for a nonpalpable testis.
gold_answer: In our review, we identified that a significant number of testicular remnants associated with the vanishing testes syndrome can harbor viable germ cell elements or seminiferous tubules. The exact fate of these residual elements remains unknown; however, there may exist the potential for malignant transformation. Given the potential for malignant degeneration, we believe that these remnants should be removed.

pred_answer: Routine CXR after bronchoscopy and TBB is not necessary, since it does not detect pneumothorax that would have been missed clinically.
gold_answer: We conclude that routine CXR after bronchoscopy with TBB is necessary only in patients with symptoms suggestive of pneumothorax. In asymptomatic patients, pneumothorax is rare and usually small, so routine CXR is not necessary in this category of patients.

pred_answer: No. The FDA warning did not significantly alter the trends of AED prescription claims.
gold_answer: During the time period considered, the FDA AED-related suicidality warning does not appear to have significantly affected prescription claims of AED medications for the study population.

pred_answer: The updated guidelines for cervical cancer screening have led to a decrease in the frequency of Pap tests. This study found that the majority of patients with IAC were diagnosed after a normal Pap test. These results suggest that the updated guidelines may miss some cases of IAC, especially in young women. Further studies are needed to determine
gold_answer: In this small retrospective study, updated Pap test screening guidelines would not have missed invasive cancer on average among screened women age 30 and older. However, young patients aged 21-29 years may be at increased risk of developing IAC of the cervix between the recommended screening intervals.

pred_answer: Yes. Adjustment for reporting heterogeneity is necessary when evaluating the association between sleep disorders and socio-demographic and life-style factors.
gold_answer: Sleep disorders are common in the general adult population of Japan. Correction for reporting heterogeneity using anchoring vignettes is not a necessary tool for proper management of sleep and energy related problems among Japanese adults. Older age, gender differences in communicating sleep-related problems, the presence of multiple morbidities, and regular exercise should be the focus of policies and clinical practice to improve sleep and energy management in Japan.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that the aortic arch angle may be an important anatomical factor influencing the severity of aortic injury.
gold_answer: The severity of TAI is influenced by the sharpness of the aortic arch. There is an inverse relationship between the severity of aortic injury and the aortic arch index.

pred_answer: The Turkish version of the EQ-5D has good construct validity in patients with acute coronary syndrome.
gold_answer: The Turkish version of the EQ-5D-based utility score seems to be a valid instrument in the assessment of quality of life studies in patients with acute coronary syndrome.

pred_answer: No. The preoperative CRP level does not predict the definitive pathological stage in patients with clinically localized PC.
gold_answer: In patients with clinically localized PC, CRP does not appear to possess the predictive value and it was shown to have patients with other tumor entities or advanced PC.

pred_answer: The clinical features of the four patients with chronic progressive cervical myelopathy and HTLV-I infection were similar to those of HAM/TSP. The present findings suggest that cervical myelopathy may be a variant form of HAM/TSP.
gold_answer: These four cases may belong to a variant form of HAM/TSP, predominantly involving the cervical cord levels.

pred_answer: No. Patients with concussion were not compliant with discharge instructions. Patients with sports-related concussion were more likely to follow up with a trainer but were also more likely to RTP without medical clearance.
gold_answer: Pediatric patients discharged from the ED are mostly compliant with concussion instructions. However, a significant number of patients RTP on the day of injury, while experiencing symptoms or without medical clearance.

pred_answer: The preoperative pain history is a significant factor in predicting the postoperative pain level.
gold_answer: Significant postoperative pain can be expected in the following situations: pain after prior surgery, presence of chronic pain sustained for more than six months, intense preoperative pain, state of depression.

pred_answer: Second-line PCT before CLM resection is associated with a shorter DFS but similar OS compared to first-line. The decision to perform second-line PCT should be individualized.
gold_answer: CLM resection following second-line PCT, after oncosurgically favourable selection, could bring similar OS compared to what observed after first-line. For initially unresectable patients, OS or DFS is comparable between first- and second-line PCT. Surgery should not be denied after the failure of first-line chemotherapy.

pred_answer: No. The results suggest that the relationship between socio-economic deprivation and mortality is stable across different geographical contexts in Scotland.
gold_answer: The homogeneity we found in the deprivation-mortality relationship across the regions of Scotland and the absence of a contextualized effect of region highlights the importance of taking a broader strategic policy that can combat the toxic impacts of socio-economic deprivation on health. Focusing on a few specific places (e.g. 15% of the poorest areas) to concentrate resources might be a good start but the impact of socio-economic deprivation on mortality is not restricted to a few places. A comprehensive strategy that can be sustained over time might be needed to interrupt the linkages between poverty and mortality.

pred_answer: Intravenous thrombolysis is associated with a higher risk of symptomatic intracerebral hemorrhage and mortality in women, but not with a lower likelihood of functional independence.
gold_answer: Data from Safe Implementation of Treatments in Stroke-International Stroke Thrombolysis Register suggest that intravenous thrombolysis may modify the observed survival and recovery advantage for men expected in the natural course of an ischemic stroke, with a possible larger beneficial treatment effect in women when compared with men.

pred_answer: Suturing the nasal septum after septoplasty is an effective alternative to nasal packing. It has several advantages over nasal packing such as less postoperative pain, less postoperative adhesions, and shorter operating time.
gold_answer: Septal suturing after septoplasty offers the following advantages: elimination of discomfort for the patients, minimal complications, the outcome is almost the same as with nasal packing, and finally the hospital stay is less than with nasal packing. Therefore, suturing of the nasal septum after septoplasty should be a preferred alternative to nasal packing.

pred_answer: Yes. Mode of delivery, antenatal care status and nursery type are useful predictors of discordant outcomes in newborns undergoing TEOAE and AABR screening.
gold_answer: Given the available screening technologies, discordant TEOAE and AABR may be inevitable for some categories of hearing loss among apparently healthy newborns whose mothers received prenatal care. The potential limitations of perinatal morbidities as basis of targeted screening for such cases therefore merit further consideration.

pred_answer: No. The high prevalence of BD in patients with acute MDE reported here is due to the use of different diagnostic algorithms. The results suggest that the current diagnostic criteria for BD are too restrictive and that the diagnostic process should be more flexible.
gold_answer: The diagnosis of BD in patients with MDE depends strongly on the method and criteria employed. The considerable difference between criteria-free physician's diagnosis and the remaining algorithms indicate the usefulness of criteria lists within the everyday clinical setting.

pred_answer: No. The acute phase response is more pronounced after RRP than after RALP.
gold_answer: This study showed for the first time that RALP induces lower tissue trauma than RRP.

pred_answer: No. The addition of saline to the vaginal fluid on the microscopy slide causes a systematic increase in pH that leads to false positive readings.
gold_answer: Vaginal pH should be measured by bringing the pH strip in direct contact with fresh vaginal fluid without first adding saline.

pred_answer: Preloading with colloids prevents hemodynamic changes when neurosurgical patients are subsequently changed to the seated position.
gold_answer: It is concluded that preloading colloid fluid prior to repositioning could prevent the decrease of systolic blood pressure and central venous pressure during sitting positioning without other complications.

pred_answer: No. The left ventricular ejection fraction and regional wall motion were unchanged after fibrous tissue resection in endomyocardial fibrosis.
gold_answer: Although endomyocardial fibrosis patients have improved clinical symptoms after surgery, the global left ventricular ejection fraction and regional wall motion in these patients do not change. This finding suggests that other explanations, such as improvements in diastolic function, may be operational.

pred_answer: The retromandibular transparotid approach is a reliable option for the surgical treatment of condylar fractures.
gold_answer: According to the results of the present study, the retromandibular transparotid approach is a viable and safe approach for the surgical treatment of condylar fractures.

pred_answer: The results suggest that Francophones have better mental health outside urban areas, but not within them. This may be due to differences in social status, lifestyle, and access to health care.
gold_answer: The discrepancy in how Francophones view their mental health and their rates of diagnosed mental disorders may be related to health seeking behaviours in the Francophone population. Community and government agencies should try to improve the mental health of this population through mental health promotion and by addressing language and cultural barriers to health services.

pred_answer: No. The current distinction between complete and incomplete SCI does not have sufficient discriminatory power to predict 1-year independent ambulation.
gold_answer: Out of the four sacral sparing criteria, the acute phase anal sensory score measurements do not contribute significantly to the prognosis of independent ambulation. The combination of the acute phase voluntary anal contraction and the S4-5 LT and PP scores, predicts significantly better chronic phase-independent ambulation outcomes than the currently used distinction between complete and incomplete SCI.

pred_answer: In children, clinical assessment with selective use of imaging studies can be used to diagnose appendicitis.
gold_answer: Clinical assessment is the key to diagnose appendicitis. Nevertheless, in girls older than 10 years, selected use of imaging should be implemented to avoid unnecessary appendectomies. Imaging of choice in equivocal cases should be ultrasonography.

pred_answer: The DAR is a useful tool for identifying high-risk cases for potential spinal cord monitoring alerts in pediatric 3-column thoracic spinal deformity corrective surgery.
gold_answer: In patients undergoing 3-column osteotomies for severe spinal deformities, the DAR was predictive of patients developing intraoperative motor evoked potential alerts. Identifying accurate radiographical, patient, and procedural risk factors in the correction of severe deformities can help prepare the surgical team to improve safety and outcomes when carrying out complex spinal corrections.

pred_answer: Women with a history of ACD have a higher risk of recurrent PTB than women with a history of PPROM or PTL. These findings suggest that the clinical presentation of a prior SPTB may be useful in identifying women who are at increased risk for recurrent PTB.
gold_answer: Patients with a history of ACD are at an increased risk of having recurrent preterm birth and cervical shortening in a subsequent pregnancy compared with women with prior preterm birth associated PPROM or PTL.

pred_answer: Yes. All four ethnic groups exhibit socio-economic mortality gradients. The steeper gradients among Maori suggest that they are more vulnerable to the adverse effects of socio-economic disadvantage.
gold_answer: While socio-economic gradients in health exist among all ethnic groups, they are relatively shallow among Pacific and (especially) Asian peoples. For these ethnic groups, caution should be exercised in applying deprivation or other socio-economic measures as proxy indicators of need for health services.

pred_answer: No. The extent of lymphadenectomy should not be modified by NACT in cervical cancer.
gold_answer: The frequency and topographic distribution of LNM are not modified by NACT, and clinical non-responders showed more involved LNs. A systemic and extensive lymphadenectomy should be performed in patients treated with NACT plus surgery regardless of the response to NACT.

pred_answer: Lower FPG levels at diagnosis of type 2 diabetes are associated with a reduced risk for most clinical and surrogate outcomes.
gold_answer: People presenting with type 2 diabetes with lower initial glycemia who may be earlier in the course of their disease had fewer adverse clinical outcomes despite similar glycemic progression. Since most such people are asymptomatic at diagnosis, active case detection programs would be required to identify them.

pred_answer: No. The association between hypoalbuminemia and poor survival in patients with gastric cancer is likely to be secondary to an ongoing systemic inflammatory response.
gold_answer: Low albumin concentrations are associated with poorer survival in patients with gastric cancer. However, the strength of this relation with survival is dependent on the presence of a systemic inflammatory response, as evidenced by an elevated CRP level. Therefore, it appears that the relation between hypoalbuminemia and poor survival is secondary to that of the systemic inflammatory response.

pred_answer: No. Intraischemic preconditioning and ramp ischemia are equally effective as conventional ischemic preconditioning in reducing myocardial infarction after prolonged ischemia.
gold_answer: The preconditioning effect (infarct size reduction) appears not to depend on intermittent reperfusion. Thus, the protective mechanism of IP develops during the initial ischemia that precedes the index ischemia. Alternatively, low-flow ischemia is effectively a sort of reperfusion.

pred_answer: No. Arterial line sampling is not reliable for the measurement of APTT ratio after cardiac surgery. This is due to the presence of heparin contamination.
gold_answer: Samples withdrawn from heparinized arterial lines cannot be relied upon for APTT ratio results.

pred_answer: Obesity at the start of adolescence is a risk factor for wheezing among adolescents.
gold_answer: Since obesity at the start of adolescence is associated with asthma symptom persistence, prevention and treatment of obesity may reduce avoidable healthcare costs and disease burden.

pred_answer: Yes. The PHQ-9 can be used to assess depression in people with vision loss.
gold_answer: Our findings demonstrate that the PHQ-9, when scaled with Rasch analysis, forms a linear interval measurement of depressive symptoms suitable for use in a vision impaired population.

pred_answer: The inverse equity hypothesis does not appear to hold for cancer screening in middle-income countries.
gold_answer: Economic inequalities in breast and cervical cancer screening are low in LMICs with high screening coverage. These findings are consistent with the inverse equity hypothesis and indicate that high levels of equity in cancer screening are feasible even in countries with high income inequality.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that viral infections may play a role in the pathogenesis of BPPV.
gold_answer: BPPV is associated with positive viral serology, particularly during certain months of the year, mainly in spring and autumn. Viral infection might promote BPPV attacks due to the development of vestibulopathy or induce secondary BPPV via viral infection-related neurolabyrinthitis.

pred_answer: No. The risk of multiple pregnancies is high in COS-IUI in couples with unexplained non-conception.
gold_answer: In COS-IUI for unexplained non-conception, induction of more than one follicle did not improve the ongoing PR, but increased the risk of multiple pregnancies. Multiple PR remained high in the first four cycles with multifollicular stimulation. Therefore, in order to reduce the number of multiple pregnancies, in all IUI cycles for unexplained non-conception monofollicular growth should be aimed at.

pred_answer: Yes. Women residents are more likely than men to perceive pregnancy as a threat to their careers and are less likely to plan to have children during residency.
gold_answer: Women residents intentionally postpone pregnancy because of perceived threats to their careers. Medical educators should be aware of these findings when counseling female trainees.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that elderly patients have poor knowledge of stroke and do not correctly endorse the response to call for emergency services when presented with signs and symptoms of stroke. These findings are important because they highlight the need for public health campaigns to improve knowledge of stroke and its treatment.
gold_answer: These results suggest the need to provide interventions that are specifically designed to increase awareness of potential stroke signs and symptoms and appropriate subsequent clinical actions.

pred_answer: Yes. Mitochondria play a role in remodelling lace plant leaves during programmed cell death. The results show that mitochondrial dynamics change during PCD in vivo. These changes may be important for the regulation of PCD.
gold_answer: Results depicted mitochondrial dynamics in vivo as PCD progresses within the lace plant, and highlight the correlation of this organelle with other organelles during developmental PCD. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first report of mitochondria and chloroplasts moving on transvacuolar strands to form a ring structure surrounding the nucleus during developmental PCD. Also, for the first time, we have shown the feasibility for the use of CsA in a whole plant system. Overall, our findings implicate the mitochondria as playing a critical and early role in developmentally regulated PCD in the lace plant.

pred_answer: The results show that older patients who refuse to participate in a self-management intervention differ from those who agree to participate. Refusers are more restricted in their mobility, live further away from the location of the intervention, and have a partner more often. The main reasons given for refusing to participate are lack of time, travel distance
gold_answer: As in many studies, the refusal rate in this study is high, and seems to be related to physical mobility restrictions, travel distance and, partly, to availability of emotional support. These findings may be used to make the recruitment process more effective - for example, by offering transport to the location of the intervention.

pred_answer: Yes. Psychological distress predicts disability due to common chronic disorders.
gold_answer: Psychological distress is an independent risk factor for disability. Its predictive significance varies between disorders leading to functional deterioration. The association mechanisms are likely to vary from one disorder to another.

pred_answer: The antismoking advertisement had a positive effect on non-smokers' attitudes towards smoking in movies but did not reduce the intention of current smokers to smoke in 12 months time.
gold_answer: This real-world study suggests that placing an antismoking advertisement before movies containing smoking scenes can help to immunise non-smokers against the influences of film stars' smoking. Caution must be exercised in the type of advertisement screened as some types of advertising may reinforce smokers' intentions to smoke.

pred_answer: No. The rate of extreme skewing in the recurrent spontaneous abortion population was not significantly different from that in the other groups.
gold_answer: Skewed X-inactivation is not associated with recurrent spontaneous abortion but is associated with increasing maternal age.

pred_answer: The results suggest that c-kit is a potential therapeutic target in uveal melanoma.
gold_answer: The results confirm that c-kit is vastly expressed in uveal melanoma, suggest that the c-kit molecular pathway may be important in uveal melanoma growth, and point to its use as a target for therapy with STI571.

pred_answer: Young patients with colorectal cancer have a different clinicopathological profile than older patients. This may reflect a different etiology and biology of the disease. However, the prognosis does not appear to be significantly worse.
gold_answer: Colorectal cancer among young patients may constitute a distinct clinical entity. Further research is needed to validate our findings and define the optimal approach in this population.

pred_answer: No. Binge drinking during early pregnancy does not appear to increase the risk of psychomotor deficits in children at age 5 years.
gold_answer: In this study, we found no systematic association between isolated episodes of binge drinking during early pregnancy and child motor function at age 5.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients were willing to participate in community-based medical education and were positive about their role in this process.
gold_answer: Patients in regional and rural settings were willing partners in developing skills of junior medical students, who had greater involvement in patient consultations than previously reported for urban students. Our study extends the findings from urban general practice that patients are underutilised partners in community-based medical training. The support of patients from regional and rural settings could facilitate the expansion of primary care-based medical education in these areas of workforce need.

pred_answer: No. The results suggest that the duration of treatment is not a relevant factor for return into mental health care.
gold_answer: The results suggest that a longer duration of treatment may prevent return into mental health care in some groups. However, because of the design of the study, no causal inference can be drawn. Further research, preferably in a RCT, is needed to determine whether the trend towards lower intensity treatments is associated with repeated mental health care use.

pred_answer: The ISF concentrations of meropenem were similar to plasma concentrations during CVVHDF. The ISF concentrations were higher than plasma concentrations after the second dose. This suggests that ISF may be a useful sampling site for monitoring meropenem concentrations in patients undergoing CVVHDF.
gold_answer: This is the first known report of concurrent plasma and ISF concentrations of a meropenem antibiotic during CVVHDF. We observed that the ISF concentrations of meropenem were significantly lower than the plasma concentrations, although the present dose was appropriate for infections caused by intermediately susceptible pathogens (MIC≤4 mg/L).

pred_answer: In hypertensive patients, the presence of MetS is associated with an increase in left atrial diameter.
gold_answer: Left ventricular dimensions are not influenced by MetS. Rather than MetS, hypertension is primarily responsible for changes in left ventricular dimensions. However, left atrial enlargement is more prominent in patients with MetS, suggesting that each MetS criterion contributes to left ventricular diastolic dysfunction.

pred_answer: Yes. Alveolar macrophage phagocytic dysfunction is present in children with PBB and bronchiectasis and may represent an early event in the development of bronchiectasis.
gold_answer: A reduced alveolar macrophage phagocytic host response to apoptotic cells or NTHi may contribute to neutrophilic inflammation and NTHi colonization in both PBB and bronchiectasis. Whether this mechanism also contributes to the progression of PBB to bronchiectasis remains unknown.

pred_answer: Sex has a significant impact on the outcome of laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Male patients have a higher conversion rate and a longer operating time than female patients. Biliary injuries occur more frequently in men.
gold_answer: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy is often challenging in men on account of more adhesions and inflammation. This leads to higher conversion rates and more postoperative complications. Optimized planning and a more experienced operating surgeon may help overcome these problems.

pred_answer: Yes. The HIV/AIDS epidemic in Jamaica has been contained and the HIV prevalence in the general population remains low. The KAP surveys show that there has been an increase in condom use and a decline in risky sexual behaviour.
gold_answer: HIV/STD control measures appear to have slowed the HIV/AIDS epidemic in Jamaica, however a significant minority of persons continue to have unprotected sex in high risk situations.

pred_answer: The CCB is a public health response to addressing the issue of caregiver burden in P/EOL care. However, it does not adequately address all of the determinants of health that are implicated in caregiver burden. We recommend that the CCB be improved to better address these determinants.
gold_answer: This study, from the perspective of family caregivers, demonstrates that the CCB is not living up to its full potential in sustaining informal P/EOL caregivers. Effort is required to transform the CCB so that it may fulfill the potential it holds for serving as one public health response to caregiver burden that forms part of a healthy public policy that addresses the determinants of this burden.

pred_answer: Yes. The strategic use of PMS in health care organizations is associated with an improvement in processes of care.
gold_answer: This study contributes to the literature investigating the design and implementation of a non-financial measurement tool, such as the non-financial information included into a balanced scorecard (BSC), in health care organizations. Managers in health care organizations can benefit from the strategic use of PMS to effectively allocate their time to strategic opportunities and threats, which might arise and affect organizational, output-related performance, such as improving processes.

pred_answer: No. Delays in time to primary treatment after a diagnosis of breast cancer do not appear to impact survival.
gold_answer: Time to primary treatment after a diagnosis of breast cancer had no impact on overall survival. Further studies on care before diagnosis are important in drawing up meaningful quality indicators.

This poses a question over the efficacy of feed-back of pharmacy information in order to create this awareness. This information needs to be more frequent and richer in content, and to be complemented by other measures.

pred_answer: Children, parents, and physicians underestimate the body size of overweight and obese children.
gold_answer: Many children underestimated their degree of overweight. Their parents and even their attending physicians shared this misperception. This study demonstrates the need to further educate physicians to recognize obesity and overweight so that they can counsel children and their families.

pred_answer: The use of PIBS points for dose assessment in image-guided brachytherapy for cervical cancer is reliable.
gold_answer: The doses evaluated at PIBS points are not impacted by intrafractional movements. PIBS and PIBS +2 dose points allow distinguishing the plans of patients with vaginal infiltration. Further studies are needed to correlate these parameters with vaginal morbidity.

pred_answer: Remote postischemic conditioning did not reduce the increase in troponin in patients undergoing elective PCI. This effect was not modified by diabetes.
gold_answer: This clinical trial evaluated the possible reduction in intervention-related myocardial damage that was attributable to remote postischemic conditioning.

pred_answer: Yes. Ascitis volume and anthropometric measurements are relevant for long-term outcome in alcoholic cirrhotics.
gold_answer: A greater association than hitherto acknowledged, between ascitis volume and anthropometric measurements from one side, and long-term rehospitalization and mortality from the other, was demonstrated in male stable alcoholic cirrhotics. Further studies with alcoholic and other modalities of cirrhosis including women are recommended.

gold_answer: Maintaining viral load suppression over time in resource-limited-settings is feasible.

pred_answer: Neighbourhood ethnic density is associated with depression diagnosis and antidepressant prescribing for some ethnic groups but not others. This suggests that the association between neighbourhood ethnic density and depression may be complex and needs further investigation.
gold_answer: New depression diagnosis and antidepressant use was shown to be less likely in areas of higher own-ethnic density for some, but not all, ethnic groups.

gold_answer: Premature births from rural mothers have a higher risk of stillbirth and mortality in neonatal intensive care than urban infants.

gold_answer: Halofantrine has mild to moderate pathological effects on cochlea histology, and can be considered an ototoxic drug.

gold_answer: This study confirms that a large percentage of patients use metered-dose inhalers improperly. pred_answer: Yes. Students who scored below the 30th percentile on any of the four year 2 CPEs had a 67% chance of failing the senior CPE. This finding suggests that preclerkship performance examinations can be used to identify students at risk for failing a senior CPE.

pred_answer: The scrotal approach is a safe and effective method for treating both palpable and impalpable undescended testes. It can be used as a first-line approach in the management of undescended testes.
gold_answer: Initial single scrotal incision can be recommended for orchidopexy, even in the more difficult cases of impalpable undescended testes. Advantages seem to include shorter operative time, a cosmetically appealing single incision, and possibly less pain. The scrotal incision technique significantly reduces the need for laparoscopy in impalpable testes. Surprisingly, it even allows successful orchidopexy of abdominal testes, provided an open processus is present.

pred_answer: The 30-day and 1-year mortality rates in emergency general surgery laparotomies are high. This is particularly true in the elderly population. These results highlight the need for further research into the causes of these poor outcomes and the development of strategies to improve patient care.
gold_answer: Emergency laparotomy carries a high rate of mortality, especially in those over the age of 70 years, and more needs to be done to improve outcomes, particularly in this group. This could involve increasing acute surgical care manpower, early recognition of patients requiring emergency surgery, development of clear management protocols for such patients or perhaps even considering centralisation of emergency surgical services to specialist centres with multidisciplinary teams involving emergency surgeons and care of the elderly physicians in hospital and related community outreach services for post-discharge care.

gold_answer: Although initial infection control rate was substantially lower in the retention group than the removal group, final results were comparable at latest followup. We believe retention treatment can be selectively considered for non-S. aureus infection, and when applied in selected patients, polyethylene exchange should be performed.

pred_answer: The mean differences between the treated and the control knee were small and did not differ significantly for any of the bony landmarks. The mean difference between the two observers was also small and did not differ significantly for any of the bony landmarks. We conclude that the distances from the bony landmarks to the JL of the contr
gold_answer: As a new assessment method, we have suggested to assess the JL by means of radiographs of the contralateral knee. The most precise parameter was found to be the distance between the fibular head and the JL. The level of arthritis, age, gender, visibility of the landmarks, and misalignment did not influence measurement accuracy. This parameter is the first tibia-related landmark for assessing the JL, which advantageously corresponds to the tibia-first technique in revision surgery.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the ability to perform transurethral resection of the prostate is influenced by the surgeon's previous experience.
gold_answer: The senior urologist was capable of resecting four times more tissue per time unit than the more inexperienced surgeons. Therefore, a surgeon's experience may be important to reduce the risk of secondary TURP due to recurring adenomas or adenomas that were incompletely resected. However, the incidence of complications was the same between the three groups.

pred_answer: MRI is a reliable method for detecting occult post-traumatic bone and cartilage injuries of the knee. It is more sensitive than arthroscopy in detecting bone bruises and subchondral injuries, but less sensitive in detecting osteochondral injuries. MRI should be considered as an alternative to arthroscopy in the diagnosis of
gold_answer: After comparing MR with arthroscopic findings and reviewing the available literature, we conclude that arthroscopy permits the direct visualization of even fine articular surface changes but does not depict the subchondral bone, the most frequent site of injury detected with MRI. MRI was a very useful tool in the detection and characterization of the different types of occult bone and/or cartilage injuries and showed a statistically significant correlation between site and distribution of bone and cartilage injuries and between internal damage and trauma mechanisms. Therefore, we believe that MRI can help avoid diagnostic arthroscopy in the patients with a history of post-traumatic pain, acute articular blocks and negative radiographic findings.

gold_answer: Although most players in the study believe that rugby headgear may prevent concussion, only a minority reported wearing it. Coaches tended to be less convinced than the players that rugby headgear can prevent concussion.

Because of the poorer long-term results from percutaneous needle suspension than from other techniques of open retropubic bladder neck suspension, it remains questionable whether percutaneous needle suspension should be considered a first-line procedure for the treatment of female stress urinary incontinence.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the degree of the patients' body mass index influences the morbidity and long-term survival of gastric cancer patients after gastrectomy.
gold_answer: The body mass index is one of the prognostic factors of stage 2 and stage 3a gastric cancer. However, it does not appear to be useful for determining the prognosis of stage 1a, 1b, 3b, and 4a gastric cancers.

gold_answer: Although the cost-effectiveness of a single-pill strategy was within the acceptable willingness-to-pay threshold, the QALY difference were minimal. Further research is recommended to explore the long-term impact of the strategy.

pred_answer: The findings of this study suggest that TB patients in China have low adherence rates to prescribed treatments. The results also indicate that the current TB control program in China has room for improvement.
gold_answer: Despite recent efforts, a large proportion of newly confirmed TB patients could not adhere to standard TB treatment, and patients' lost to follow-up was still a serious problem. Poor treatment supervision and heavy financial burden might be the main causes for non-adherence. More needs to be done to enhance treatment supervision policies and financial supports to both health providers and TB patients.

pred_answer: The reOSCE is a feasible method of assessment that allows physician-examiners to participate remotely. This method has the potential to increase the number of available examiners and reduce costs associated with travel. However, further research is needed to determine the reliability of the reOSCE and to identify ways to improve the technology.
gold_answer: This preliminary study demonstrated that OSCE ratings by LEs and REs were reasonably comparable when using checklists. Remote examination may be a feasible and acceptable way of assessing students' clinical skills, but further validity evidence will be required before it can be recommended for use in high-stakes examinations.

pred_answer: No. Patients with chronic functional somatic symptoms have a high prevalence of comorbid somatic and psychiatric disorders, and use more somatic and psychotropic drugs. gold_answer: Patients with chronic functional somatic symptoms have a great diversity of functional somatic symptoms. They use more somatic and psychotropic drugs than controls in the years before diagnosis. Moreover, they show high rates of referrals and psychiatric morbidity. The diversity of symptoms of patients with chronic functional somatic symptoms supports the concept that symptoms do not cluster in well defined distinct syndromes. Therefore, patients with chronic functional somatic symptoms should preferably not be classified into medical subspecialty syndromes.

gold_answer: These findings confirm the hypothesis that TLI assessed at late childhood is a predictor of frequency and severity of suicidal behavior from preadolescence to young adulthood.

pred_answer: In acute aortic dissection, complete resection of all dissected aortic segments is feasible in most cases. gold_answer: Surrogates of injury severity, including days in the ICU and non-ICU hospital LOS>10 days, were associated with the development of HO in our cohort of acetabular fracture patients. pred_answer: The gender difference in survival of resected non-small cell lung cancer is mainly due to the different distribution of histology and pathologic stage.

gold_answer: Chemical shift subtraction can contribute to routine dynamic contrast subtraction in morphologic analysis particularly for the evaluation of margins of benign lesions in fatty breasts. It can also help in morphologic analysis of masses in dense breast.

pred_answer: Yes. Parental restriction of R-rated movie viewing is associated with lower adolescent smoking susceptibility.
gold_answer: Parental restriction of R-rated movie viewing is associated with both lower adolescent smoking susceptibility and lower smoking rates.

pred_answer: The results suggest that cytokeratin 7/20 immunostaining may be useful in the diagnosis of short-segment Barrett's oesophagus in Korea.
gold_answer: Barrett's cytokeratin 7/20 pattern can be a useful marker for the diagnosis of short-segment Barrett's oesophagus, although the false positive or false negative rate is approximately 25%.

pred_answer: Induction chemotherapy improves the outcome of patients with advanced NPC. The addition of concomitant boost fractionation to the standard fractionation schedule does not improve the outcome of patients with advanced NPC.
gold_answer: While not providing conclusive evidence, this single institution experience suggests that neoadjuvant chemotherapy for Stage IV NPC patients improves both survival and disease control. Recurrence within the irradiated volume was the most prevalent mode of failure and future studies will evaluate regimens to enhance local regional control.

pred_answer: The data suggest that comorbid MD/AUD in adolescence is associated with poorer outcomes of MD in adulthood, but this association is largely accounted for by childhood behavior problems and exposure to physical and sexual abuse.
gold_answer: The results of these analyses suggest that marginally higher rates of depression to age 35 amongst the comorbid MD/AUD group were explained by increased exposure to adverse childhood circumstances amongst members of the comorbid group. Adolescent MD/AUD comorbidity is likely to be a risk marker, rather than a causal factor in subsequent MD.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that T-cell deficiency may play an important role in spatial learning ability following toluene exposure.
gold_answer: These results indicate that T-cell deficiency may affect spatial learning performance following toluene exposure.

pred_answer: In this large cohort of severely injured trauma patients, female gender was independently associated with a reduced risk of multiple organ failure and nosocomial infection. This effect was present in both young and old age groups.
gold_answer: The independent protective effect of female gender on multiple organ failure and nosocomial infection rates remains significant in both premenopausal and postmenopausal women when compared with similarly aged men. This is contrary to previous experimental studies and the known physiologic sex hormone changes that occur after menopause in women. These results suggest that factors other than sex hormones may be responsible for gender-based differences after injury.

pred_answer: The present study shows that a minority of adult patients with CD can develop tolerance to gluten. This may be due to a genetic predisposition.
gold_answer: Development of tolerance to gluten seems possible in some patients with CD. Further follow-up will show whether this tolerance is permanent or only a long-term return to latency. This feature may be associated with genetic characteristics, especially with HLA genotypes that differ from DQ2 or DQ8. More insight into the mechanisms of the development of gluten tolerance may help to distinguish those CD patients that might not require life-long GFD.

pred_answer: Surgery and radiation therapy improve survival for patients with extrapulmonary small cell cancer.
gold_answer: Although outcomes for EPSCC remains poor, both surgery and radiation is shown to significantly improve median, 5- and 10-year survival rates. EPSCC patients who are potential candidates for surgical resection or radiation therapy may benefit from these treatments.

pred_answer: Symptoms matter when considering patients for PICT. Older adults with AC and multiple symptoms may benefit from PICT.
gold_answer: Older adults enrolled in PICT with more symptoms may sacrifice QOL for experimental treatment.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Post-operative version or percentage of DFV>15° did not significantly differ following IMN of diaphyseal femur fractures between surgeons with and without trauma fellowship training. However, prospective data that removes the inherent bias that the more complex cases are left for the traumatologists are required before a definitive comparison is made.

pred_answer: The pyloric mucosa is thickened in infants with IHPS, and this thickening is a constant finding. The pyloric mucosa may play a role in the pathogenesis of IHPS by contributing to the obstruction of the pyloric canal.
gold_answer: Mucosal redundancy is a constant associated finding in IHPS. Although the origin of the redundancy and a cause-and-effect relationship are difficult to establish, our findings support the hypothesis that hypergastrinemia may be implicated in the pathogenesis of IHPS, and suggest that mucosal thickening could be implicated as one of the initiating factors in its development.

pred_answer: The MCV is a simple and reliable marker for differentiating NASH from ASH.
gold_answer: Higher MCVs and AST/ALT ratios in ASH reflect the severity of underlying liver disease and do not differentiate NASH from ASH. Instead, these biomarkers might prove useful in guiding selection of patients for liver biopsy and in targeting therapy.

pred_answer: No. Paracervical anaesthesia does not shorten the induction to abortion interval and does not reduce the intensity of pain in the late first stage of labour.
gold_answer: Paracervical anaesthesia is a method for analgesia during second trimester abortion with a low rate of side effects. It can shorten the duration of last period of second trimester abortion in some cases but has no impact on the perception of pain nor requirement of analgesics and so with only limited benefit in second trimester abortion with vaginal gemeprost.

pred_answer: Routine dissection of station 9 lymph nodes is unnecessary for primary lung cancer.
gold_answer: The metastasis rate of station 9 lymph nodes was significantly lower than other mediastinal stations in lung cancer patients. The metastasis status of station 9 had no significant influence on tumor staging or prognosis. Routine dissection of station 9 lymph nodes may not be necessary, especially in patients with a low T stage, upper or middle lobe tumors, or without intrapulmonary lymph node metastasis.

pred_answer: Yes. Gastric bypass is a promising treatment for type 2 diabetes. It is also a potential treatment for type 1 diabetes.
gold_answer: Roux-en-Y gastric bypass is a promising option for lifelong treatment of type 2 diabetes. It has the potential to improve or cure a selected spectrum of type 1 diabetes when performed early in the disease. Further animal model studies or randomized controlled trials are needed to support our conclusion.

pred_answer: Yes. Ibuprofen increases perioperative blood loss during hip arthroplasty.
gold_answer: Pretreatment with ibuprofen before elective total hip surgery increases the perioperative blood loss significantly. Early discontinuation of non-selective non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs is advised.

pred_answer: No. Ureteral meatus dilatation is not necessary for diagnostic or therapeutic semirigid ureteroscopy.
gold_answer: In selected cases, ureteroscopy may be performed without ureteral meatus dilatation with success and morbidity rates similar to when the procedure is performed with meatal dilatation.

pred_answer: No. Antibiotics have no role in decreasing post-tonsillectomy morbidity.
gold_answer: Post tonsillectomy antibiotics did not prove to have a role in minimizing postoperative morbidity. Moreover, analgesics given on the basis of as required had a limited value.

pred_answer: Yes. A patient-safety curriculum can change medical students' attitudes towards patient safety.
gold_answer: An active learning curriculum integrated into a clinical clerkship can change learners' attitudes towards patient safety. Students found the curriculum relevant and recommended its continuation.

pred_answer: No. The variation in results was not improved when the results were corrected with a common calibrator. This suggests that the variation is not due to differences in calibration but rather due to differences in the analytical methods used.
