gold_answer: The variation in results obtained could not be attributed to variations in calibrators. The differences in methodologies between laboratories must be the reason for this variation.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that post-tonsillectomy late haemorrhage is a predominantly night-time event. This finding suggests that the risk of late haemorrhage should be considered during the night-time.
gold_answer: The incidence of post-tonsillectomy late haemorrhage in our study population was 1.78%. A statistically significant difference was found between night-time and day-time haemorrhages. Even though no significant distribution of haemorrhages per hour was observed, we underline that we recorded 32 (54.2%) events in 2 periods of the day: from 10 p.m. to 1 a.m. and from 6 to 9 a.m.

pred_answer: In this study, we found that BRAF mutation was associated with longer PFS in TKI-treated patients. However, the clinical significance of BRAF mutation in TKI-treated patients remains controversial. Further studies are needed to confirm our findings.
gold_answer: Patients with BRAF-mutant PTC had a significantly longer PFS than BRAF wild-type when treated with TKIs. However, due to the small number of BRAF-mutant patients, further investigations are required, especially to understand the potential positive effect of BRAF mutations in RAIR TC patients while having a negative prognostic impact in RAI-sensitive PTC patients.

pred_answer: Histological findings on preoperative liver biopsy can predict the outcome of portoenterostomy in biliary atresia. Patients with histological evidence of advanced disease may be better served by transplantation.
gold_answer: Based on the predictive information available in a liver biopsy, we conclude that those patients who will not benefit from a Kasai procedure can be identified preoperatively, and channeled immediately to transplantation.

pred_answer: Early extubation is feasible and safe for most children undergoing congenital heart surgery.
gold_answer: Most children undergoing congenital heart surgery can be extubated in the operating room. Most neonates, including many undergoing complex procedures, can be extubated within the first 24 hours after surgery. Early extubation was associated with low morbidity rates and short lengths of intensive care unit and hospital stays.

pred_answer: No. We did not find any significant differences in the incidence of postoperative complications between patients undergoing distal pancreatectomy with or without coverage of the resection margins.
gold_answer: The results show no significant difference in the fistula rate after covering of the resection margin after distal pancreatectomy, which contributes to the picture of an unsolved problem.

pred_answer: Inhibin is a new marker of hydatidiform mole. Its concentration in serum and tissue is elevated during the course of the disease and declines rapidly after evacuation. The concentration of inhibin in serum may be used to predict the development of persistent trophoblastic disease.
gold_answer: In this small study serum inhibin concentrations higher than those found in the early follicular phase one to two weeks after evacuation of a hydatidiform mole seemed to be specific for persistent trophoblastic disease. Further data are needed to confirm these promising results.

pred_answer: The proportion of patients receiving in-person CIED follow-up visits within 2 to 12 weeks increased from 2005 to 2009. However, the proportion of patients receiving in-person follow-up visits within 2 to 12 weeks remains low.
gold_answer: Although most Medicare beneficiaries who received a new CIED between 2005 and 2009 did not have an initial in-person CIED follow-up visit within 2 to 12 weeks after device implantation, the rate of initial follow-up improved appreciably over time. This CIED follow-up visit was significantly more common in white patients than in patients of other races.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: A set of educational interventions designed for cancer patients significantly improved their satisfaction with information on clinical research, but did not improve clinical trial enrollment of these participants as of 1 year after the study.

pred_answer: The new TNM staging system for primary tumor classification in kidney cancer is valid and retains its prognostic value. However, the substratification of pT1 tumors does not retain an independent predictive role.
gold_answer: The recently released seventh edition of the primary tumor staging system for kidney tumors is a powerful predictor of CSS. However, some of the substages identified by the classification have overlapping prognoses, and other substages include patients with heterogeneous outcomes. The few modifications included in this edition may have not resolved the most critical issues in the previous version.

pred_answer: No. In this study, we did not find a significant relationship between CFAEs and SRF. This suggests that SRF may represent a different substrate than CFAEs.
gold_answer: (1) There is little overlap between regions of CFAEs during AF and regions of SRF measured in the time domain or the frequency domain, (2) the majority of SRF appears to occur in regions with wave-front collision, (3) the distribution of SRF is similar in patients with AF and normal controls, suggesting that this may not have an important role in AF maintenance and may not be a suitable ablation target.

pred_answer: Yes. Disease activity and damage are associated with health status in SLE patients.
gold_answer: The present study, which is based on internationally accepted assessment tools for SLE patients, shows a significant relationship between increased disease activity and reduced physical function. This result emphasizes the importance of optimizing treatment aiming at reducing disease activity.

pred_answer: No. Unintended pregnancy does not appear to lessen the likelihood of desire for sterilization reversal.
gold_answer: Among women who had undergone tubal sterilization, a prior history of unintended pregnancy did not decrease desire for sterilization reversal.

pred_answer: Preoperative platelet count is an independent prognostic factor for patients with ESCC. Patients with platelet count ≤ 205 have a better prognosis than those with a platelet count>205.
gold_answer: Preoperative platelet count is a predictive factor for long-term survival in ESCC, especially in nodal-positive patients. We conclude that 205 (×10(9)/L) may be the optimum cutoff point for platelet count in predicting survival in ESCC patients.

pred_answer: The results of the present study show that CLBP patients perform worse than healthy subjects in a hand-function task. Furthermore, provocation of pain-related cognitions seems to have a negative impact on motor performance in patients with CLBP.
gold_answer: It can be concluded that CLBP patients in general have worse motor task performance compared to healthy subjects and that provoking pain-related cognitions further worsened performance.

pred_answer: In this uncontrolled trial, we observed that vitamin D supplementation significantly increased %Tregs in apparently healthy subjects. These results suggest that vitamin D may have a role in the prevention of autoimmunity.
gold_answer: Vitamin D supplementation was associated with significantly increased %Tregs in apparently healthy individuals. This immunomodulatory effect of vitamin D might underlie the associations of vitamin D deficiency and autoimmune diseases. Hence, our finding provides a rationale for further studies to investigate vitamin D effects on autoimmunological processes.

pred_answer: No. The overall time from bronchoscopy to antibiotic administration was shorter for off-hours than day-shifts due to shorter specimen collection-to-antibiotic prescription times.
gold_answer: An invasive strategy based on bronchoscopy to diagnose VAP was not associated with a longer time to first appropriate antibiotic administration when clinical suspicion of VAP occurs during off-hours.

pred_answer: The type of tibial component used in UKR affects postoperative alignment. The use of a metal-backed onlay component may result in better alignment correction than an all-polyethylene inlay component.
gold_answer: Patients who received a metal-backed Onlay tibial component obtained better postoperative mechanical alignment compared to those who received all-polyethylene Inlay prostheses. The thicker overall construct of Onlay prostheses appears to be an important determinant of postoperative alignment. Considering their higher survivorship rates and improved postoperative mechanical alignment, Onlay prostheses should be the first option when performing medial UKR.

pred_answer: The use of the rabbit as a model for training in abdominal surgery is feasible, presenting a low mortality and morbidity rates. The preoperative fasting is not necessary, since the animals presented a moderate negative degree of correlation between the quantity of gastric content and the fasting time.
gold_answer: The rabbit is a good model to be used in training of surgery, with a low morbi-mortality, able to be anesthetized intramuscularly, with no need of pre-operative fasting and does not present hypoglycemia even with the extended fasting period.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that fear of anaphylaxis and/or dissemination is the main reason for not using percutaneous and laparoscopic techniques in the treatment of liver hydatid cysts. This finding may explain why these techniques have not been widely adopted in many countries.
gold_answer: The seemingly exaggerated traditional fear of anaphylaxis seems to discourage surgeons from more widely adopting minimal access techniques for the treatment of hydatid cyst.

pred_answer: Obesity is an important risk factor for knee pain in women, even after controlling for radiographic changes.
gold_answer: Over 14 years, a higher BMI predicts knee pain at Y15 in women, independently of radiographic knee OA. When adjusted, the association was significant in bilateral, not unilateral, knee pain, suggesting alternative pathologic mechanisms may exist. The longitudinal effect of BMI on knee pain at Y15 is equally important at any time point, which may assist reducing the population burden of knee pain.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study suggest that the provision of current evidence to surgeons does not result in a change in practice.
gold_answer: This study has shown that mailing out a summary of current evidence to surgeons concerning a certain issue is not sufficient to lead to a change in practice.

pred_answer: In young adults, cycloplegic autorefraction is not necessary for the correction of mild hypermetropia. However, moderate hypermetropia requires cycloplegic autorefraction to ensure accurate correction.
gold_answer: Young hypermetropic adults possessed +1 to +2 D of latent hypermetropia. In contrast, young myopic adults revealed pseudomyopia of -0.5 D. Cycloplegic refraction should be performed in young hypermetropic adults complaining of various signs of asthenopia.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that physicians are not fully aware of the side effects of ACE-I. This may lead to inappropriate use of ACE-I and to unnecessary changes in therapy.
gold_answer: Overall, there was a poor knowledge of the side effects of ACE-I. This may account for the increased referrals for chronic cough and angioedema.

pred_answer: The EOA/patient aortic annulus area ratio is a more accurate method for comparing the hemodynamic performance of different bioprostheses.
gold_answer: Comparisons of absolute EOA values grouped by the manufacturers' valve sizes are misleading because of specific differences in geometric dimensions. The EOA:patient aortic annulus area ratio provides a new hemodynamic index which may facilitate objective comparisons between different valve types.

pred_answer: Selective embolization was an independent factor for improved survival in patients with HCC.
gold_answer: Selective embolization contributes to survival in patients with HCCs.

pred_answer: No. Viral co-infection does not influence the severity of acute respiratory infection in children. However, bacterial superinfection and lack of pneumococcal vaccination are associated with increased severity.
gold_answer: The presence of more than one virus in hospitalized children with ARI is very frequent but it does not seem to have a major clinical impact in terms of severity. However bacterial superinfection increases the severity of the disease course. On the contrary, pneumococcal vaccination plays a protective role.

pred_answer: Unsuccessful IUD insertions occurred in 33.2% of women seeking EC with the copper T380A IUD. This rate of failure is higher than previously reported in the literature. The rate of failure was higher in nulliparous women compared to parous women. The high rate of
gold_answer: The high rate of unsuccessful IUD insertions reported here, particularly for nulliparous women, suggests that the true insertion failure rate of providers who are not employing additional tools for difficult insertions may be much higher than reported in clinical trials. Further investigation is necessary to determine if this is a common problem and, if so, to assess if the use of adjuvant measures will reduce the number of unsuccessful IUD insertions.

pred_answer: The association between pre-operative fB-glu and mortality after CABG is independent of the presence of DM. Patients with IFG have a higher risk of mortality than those with normal fB-glu.
gold_answer: The elevated risk of death after CABG surgery known previously to be associated with CDM seems also to be shared by a group of similar size that includes patients with IFG and undiagnosed DM.

pred_answer: Preoperative anemia is an independent predictor of an adverse CO and increased hospital LOS after open and laparoscopic colectomy. These findings suggest that preoperative anemia should be addressed before surgery.
gold_answer: This large multicenter database analysis suggests that the presence of severe and moderate and even mild preoperative anemia is an independent risk factor for complications and a longer hospital stay after colon surgery.

pred_answer: Inflammatory phenotypes of asthma are characterized by different levels of granulocyte infiltration in the airways. However, the inflammatory profile of paucigranulocytic asthma remains unclear. We have shown that paucigranulocytic asthma is associated with a high number of eosinophils in the air
gold_answer: This study demonstrates that a significant eosinophilic inflammation is present across all categories of asthma, and that paucigranulocytic asthma may be seen as a low grade inflammatory disease.

pred_answer: The school food policy is not sufficiently implemented in practice. Principals and teachers believe that parents are primarily responsible for encouraging healthy eating habits among children. However, parents believe that the school has a responsibility to foster healthy eating habits among children. Parents appreciate the school food policy and comply with the food rules. There is room for
gold_answer: Dutch primary schools could play a more important role in fostering healthy eating habits among children. The school food policy could be improved by clearly formulating food rules, simplifying supervision of the food rules, and defining how to enforce the food rules. In addition, the school food policy will only influence children's dietary behaviour if both the school and the parents support the policy.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: The effect on venous pressures caused by the change in patient positioning alone during liver surgery does not affect the risk of venous air embolism.

pred_answer: Yes. Serum pancreatic lipase has a higher diagnostic accuracy than serum amylase for acute pancreatitis.
gold_answer: It is concluded that serum pancreatic lipase is a more accurate biomarker of acute pancreatitis than serum amylase.

pred_answer: No. The delayed phase of contrast-enhanced CT of the abdomen and pelvis provides little additional information in routine clinical practice. The radiation dose associated with the delayed phase is significant and should be considered when ordering contrast-enhanced CT examinations.
gold_answer: An additional delayed phase through the abdomen in routine contrast-enhanced CT examinations of the abdomen and pelvis is of low yield, particularly if reliable follow-up imaging to further elucidate uncertain findings is available.

pred_answer: The majority of students met the national standards for clinical encounters of selected core conditions. However, there is significant variation in the number of core conditions encountered among students.
gold_answer: Most students do not encounter all 10 conditions during patient encounters throughout a 4-week EM rotation, although most have exposure to at least eight. Certain conditions are far less likely than others to be encountered, and may need to be taught in a nonclinical setting.

pred_answer: In elderly patients, the presence of acute appendicitis can be diagnosed by the presence of an elevated leukocyte count and/or CRP value. However, the absence of these two parameters does not exclude the diagnosis of acute appendicitis.
gold_answer: Although elevated leukocyte count and CRP value cannot effectively establish the diagnosis of acute appendicitis in the elderly, unelevated values exclude it. Accordingly, appendectomy is not recommended to be performed in an elderly patient with unelevated leukocyte count and CRP value, although clinical symptoms and signs indicate acute appendicitis.

pred_answer: Monitoring the temperature during kidney allograft preservation is important. The new storage can maintains a low temperature level during preservation.
gold_answer: The new storage can affords more stable temperature levels when compared to the formerly used can. Since temperature is stable during conservation, continuous monitoring in everyday practice does not seem warranted.

pred_answer: No. The tidal volume delivered by manual resuscitator varied by the physical characteristics of the individual and the method used.
gold_answer: The tidal volume delivered by a manual resuscitator shows large variations. There were significant differences in the volume delivered by compression methods, but physical characteristics are not a predictor of tidal volume delivery. The manual resuscitator is not a suitable device for accurate ventilation.

pred_answer: Anticoagulation in trauma patients is associated with a high rate of complications. These complications are more likely to occur in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, those receiving UH, and those with lower initial platelet counts.
gold_answer: Trauma patients have a significant complication rate related to anticoagulation therapy, and predicting which patients will develop a complication remains unclear. Prospective studies are needed to determine which treatment regimen, if any, is appropriate to safely anticoagulate this high risk population.

pred_answer: Curative therapy prolongs LE but does not improve QALE in older men with localized prostate cancer. The benefits of curative therapy are limited to men with low-risk disease and few comorbidities.
gold_answer: Potentially curative therapy results in significantly improved LE and QALE for older men with few comorbidities and moderately or poorly differentiated localized prostate cancer. Age should not be a barrier to treatment in this group.

pred_answer: The cost-effectiveness of pharmacologic regimens for knee OA prevention depends on the target population and drug characteristics.
gold_answer: The cost-effectiveness of DMOADs for OA prevention for persons at high risk for incident OA may be comparable to other accepted preventive therapies.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that GM may be associated with better disease-free survival than SM. However, the overall survival rate was similar for both strategies. The choice of management strategy should be individualized according to the patient's clinical situation.
gold_answer: GM of CRC and SLM was associated with fewer procedures but did not influence overall survival. SM was associated with a longer delay and increased use of chemotherapy between procedures, suggesting that more rigorous selection of SM patients for surgery may explain the higher disease-free survival after SLM resection.

pred_answer: A 5% increase in circumference at any site is a reliable method to detect early lymphedema.
gold_answer: An increase of 5% in circumference measurements identified the most potential lymphedema cases compared with an academic trial.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that LA can be safely performed for adrenal masses larger than 7 cm. The main limitation of our study is its retrospective nature and the small number of patients. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: LA for adrenal masses larger than 7 cm is a safe and feasible technique, offering successful outcome in terms of intraoperative and postoperative morbidity, hospital stay and cosmesis for patients; it seems to replicate open surgical oncological principles demonstrating similar outcomes as survival rate and recurrence rate, when adrenal cortical carcinoma were treated. The main contraindication for this approach is the evidence, radiologically and intraoperatively, of local infiltration of periadrenal tissue.

pred_answer: No. Our results suggest that the July effect does not exist in patients undergoing major cancer surgery.
gold_answer: On the whole, the data confirm an absence of a July effect in patients undergoing major cancer surgery.

pred_answer: No. Puberty is associated with increased risk of alcohol use in young adolescents, but this association is not moderated by family factors.
gold_answer: Puberty and family factors were strong predictors of adolescent alcohol use, but family factors did not account for variation in the association of pubertal stage and alcohol use.

pred_answer: The study suggests that older patients are not receiving adequate stroke care. Older patients are less likely to undergo brain imaging and are less likely to be given dietary advice. These findings suggest that there is a need for improved care for older patients.
gold_answer: Older patients were less likely to receive diagnostic investigations and lifestyle modification advice than younger patients. Guidelines need to be adopted to ensure prompt evidence-based stroke care in the outpatient setting.

pred_answer: No. In elderly patients undergoing AVR with small prosthesis size, PPM does not influence survival and QoL.
gold_answer: PPM after AVR does not affect survival, functional status, and QoL in patients aged at least 75 years. Surgical procedures, often time-consuming, contemplated to prevent PPM, may therefore be not justified in this patient subgroup.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that rotator cuff tears are more common in certain occupations. The high incidence of rotator cuff tears in the building industry may be due to repetitive shoulder movements and heavy lifting. In agriculture and forestry, the high incidence of rotator cuff tears may be due to the high physical demands of these
gold_answer: Our data suggest that working exposure increases the risk or leads to the clinical manifestation of rotator cuff tears. Although a detailed analysis of individual physical exposure is not available yet, the statistical results indicate that rotator cuff tears must be taken into consideration as a result of ergonomic exposure.

pred_answer: The attendance rate in the NBCSP was higher in the Sami than in the non-Sami population. The recall rate was lower in the Sami population. The percentage of all breast cancers detected in the NBCSP was lower in the Sami population.
gold_answer: Despite a lower risk of breast cancer, the Sami attended the NBCSP more frequently than the control group. The recall and cancer detection rate was lower among the Sami compared with the non-Sami group.

pred_answer: Yes. The MQSA has had a positive effect on mammography quality in North Carolina.
gold_answer: In 1995, the first year that the MQSA was in effect, there was a significant improvement in the quality of mammography in North Carolina. This improvement probably resulted from facilities' compliance with federal regulations.

pred_answer: We have demonstrated that uNK cells are increased in the endometrium during bleeding episodes in HT users. This may be due to the increased expression of IL-15 in the endometrium during bleeding. These findings suggest that uNK cells may play an important role in the pathogenesis of irregular bleeding in HT users
gold_answer: Little is known about the mechanisms underlying irregular bleeding in HT users. This is the first report of uNK cells and their association with regulating cytokines in postmenopausal endometrium and demonstrates a possible mechanism by which HT may induce irregular bleeding.

pred_answer: This study provides evidence that fears of recurrence are best predicted by pre-treatment fears and optimism. This finding has important implications for the development of interventions aimed at reducing fears of recurrence in HNC survivors.
gold_answer: Although components of the CSM (cognitive and emotional representations, coping strategies) were associated with fears of recurrence, optimism was found to be the strongest predictor of fear, independent of anxiety and level of fear reported prior to treatment.

pred_answer: Midwives in rural areas are less likely to report competence in some skills, but more likely to report competence in others. The reasons for this are complex and may relate to the differing nature of the work in rural and urban settings. Midwives in both settings face barriers to continuing professional development, but these differ according to the
gold_answer: It is often assumed that midwives in rural areas where there are fewer deliveries, will be less competent and confident in their practice. Our exploratory study suggests that the issue of competence is far more complex and deserves further attention.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study suggest that availability of sports facilities and parks are not related to sports participation among Dutch adolescents. However, neighbourhood social capital is positively associated with sports participation. Furthermore, the interaction between neighbourhood social capital and availability of parks is associated with sports participation.
gold_answer: The results of this study indicate that leisure time sports participation is associated with levels of NSC, but not with availability of parks or sports facilities. In addition, NSC and availability of parks in the zip code area interacted in such a way that leisure time sports participation is most likely among adolescents living in zip code areas with higher levels of NSC, and higher availability of parks. Hence, availability of parks appears only to be important for leisure time sports participation when NSC is high.

pred_answer: Yes. Severe OSA patients are more likely to require high CPAP pressures.
gold_answer: Severe OSA patients are much more likely to need high CPAP levels. However, because of the low positive predictive value (only 28.6%), the clinical value of such information is limited. ESS and MSLT did not increase the predictive value for the need for high CPAP.

pred_answer: Anterior laxity of the uninjured knee is associated with the clinical outcomes of ACL reconstruction.
gold_answer: Greater anterior laxity of the uninjured knee was associated with poorer stability and functional outcomes after ACL reconstruction. Excessive anterior laxity of the uninjured knee thus appears to represent a risk factor for inferior outcomes.

pred_answer: No. Postpartum quality of life was not affected by delivery mode in rural China.
gold_answer: Delivery mode did not affect postpartum quality of life in rural China. Socio-cultural determinants may contribute more in influencing postnatal quality of life.

pred_answer: The sensation returned to the nasal tip after microfat grafting.
gold_answer: Postoperative numbness occurs in most patients receiving nasal microfat injections. Partial to complete recovery of nasal tip sensation can be expected to occur over a 3-month period.

pred_answer: Yes. The Army recruits had a significantly higher prevalence of dental decay and greater treatment resource need than either of the other two Services.
gold_answer: A significant difference in dental health between recruits to each Service does exist and is a likely to be a reflection of the sociodemographic background from which they are drawn.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Increased D-dimer levels should not be considered as a diagnostic parameter in diagnosis of acute appendicitis.

pred_answer: Minimally invasive mitral valve repair with artificial chords is reproducible and applicable in routine surgery.
gold_answer: Minimally invasive mitral valve repair using neochords provided a high rate of repair, reproducible results in a routine cardiac surgery setting and stable repair during follow-up. This has become our preferred technique for mitral valve surgery.

pred_answer: No. Older cancer patients have similar needs to younger ones. However, the older group has a greater need for information about insurance and financial matters.
gold_answer: Elderly patients have informational and relational needs similar to those of younger patients. In fact, most of the whole sample flagged up the need for higher levels of satisfaction especially concerning a better dialogue with health staff, along with a new factor: the need to talk to people with the same illness.

pred_answer: Yes. The addition of fusion levels in AIS patients undergoing delayed surgery instead of early surgery is inevitable.
gold_answer: Delay of surgery in immature AIS patients whose Cobb's angle exceed 40° initially and showing subsequent progression of the curve, of more than 10° can lead to alterations in the curve pattern and the need for increase in fusion levels.

pred_answer: In our study, we found that the radiopharmaceutical uptake in the striatum was significantly lower in ET patients than in NV. In addition, the radiopharmaceutical uptake in the putamen was significantly lower in patients with PD than in ET and NV. These findings suggest that the radiopharmaceutical uptake in
gold_answer: Our results do not support the hypothesis of a link between essential tremor and Parkinson's disease. However, it appears that ET patients have a small degree of striatal dopaminergic degeneration. If this is due to alterations in the nigrostriatl pathway or of other origin it is not clear. Follow-up studies of essential tremor patients are warranted to assess progression of disease and to understand better the possible cause for striatal dopaminergic degeneration.

pred_answer: The present study provides evidence that apoptosis is not a major mechanism of neuronal death in MTS. However, the increased expression of Bax and activation of caspases suggest that apoptosis may play a role in the pathogenesis of MTS.
gold_answer: These data suggest that either apoptosis is not involved in cell loss in MTS, or a very slow rate of cell demise may have precluded detecting TUNEL-positive neurons dying through apoptosis. Increased Bax expression and activation of caspases support the latter possibility.

pred_answer: No. The absence of a significant difference in NT values between the two groups does not support the hypothesis that increased NT thickness in the first trimester of pregnancy can be used as a predictor of GDM onset during pregnancy.
gold_answer: NT thickness does not show a significative increase in those women who subsequently develop GDM. Therefore, NT assessment does not prove to be an useful ultrasound parameter for predicting GDM onset during pregnancy.

pred_answer: No. Women who received birth center care during their first pregnancy did not differ from those who received standard care in time to second birth.
gold_answer: A woman's model of care, such as birth center care, during her first pregnancy does not seem to be a sufficiently important factor to affect subsequent reproduction in Sweden.

pred_answer: No. Stress did not moderate the tendency to imitate drinking behavior.
gold_answer: Generally, it appears that among young male adults, imitation of alcohol consumption is a robust phenomenon not dependent on individual stress levels.

pred_answer: The results of this pilot study suggest that opioid PCT is a feasible and acceptable method for the treatment of breathlessness in palliative care. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: Opioid PCT is a feasible and acceptable therapeutic method to reduce refractory breathlessness in palliative care patients.

pred_answer: No. Wandering and PNA are not equivalent. Wandering is a single factor concept that correlates strongly with PNA Factor 1, but not with PNA Factor 2.
gold_answer: Findings depict wandering and PNA as overlapping, but nonequivalent phenomena. Evidence supporting construct validity of wandering was more robust than that for PNA. Results have implications for accuracy in scientific and clinical detection and labeling of wandering and agitation.

pred_answer: The presence of T2 HIA on MRI, the number of T2 HIA on MRI and conversion to surgery were found to be significantly associated with a poorer recovery at the observational final follow-up. The presence of the pyramidal tract sign was significantly associated with a poor recovery at the final follow-up after surgery.
gold_answer: The presence of a high signal intensity change on T2-weighted MRI and the pyramidal tract sign can be used as prognostic factors for patients with CSA.

pred_answer: In patients with a history of ICH, withholding anticoagulation therapy is strongly preferred.
gold_answer: Survivors of lobar ICH with atrial fibrillation should not be offered long-term anticoagulation. Similarly, most patients with deep hemispheric ICH and atrial fibrillation should not receive anticoagulant therapy. However, patients with deep hemispheric ICH at particularly high risk for thromboembolic stroke or low risk of ICH recurrence might benefit from long-term anticoagulation.

pred_answer: No. In our study, aspiration of ethanol-mixed fluid did not improve the success rate of percutaneous ethanol injection for benign cystic thyroid nodules.
gold_answer: Percutaneous ethanol injection without aspiration of ethanol-mixed fluid seems to be the preferable method of treatment of benign cystic thyroid nodules from the perspective of both the physician and the patient.

pred_answer: Yes. Breast-feeding has a protective effect on the health of children with a family history of atopy.
gold_answer: Our results suggest a protective effect of breast-feeding among children with a family history of atopy that is not confined to the period of breast-feeding but continues during the first three years of life. Breast-feeding should be promoted in children with a family history of atopy.

pred_answer: The presence of a household smoker was associated with lower socioeconomic status and higher rates of depressive symptoms. These findings suggest that interventions to reduce SHSe should target families with a lower socioeconomic status and those with a household smoker.
gold_answer: The most disadvantaged families were least likely to have protective health behaviors in place to reduce SHSe and, consequently, are most at-risk for tobacco exposure and subsequent tobacco-related health disparities. Innovative SHSe interventions for this vulnerable population are sorely needed.

pred_answer: Unanswerable.
gold_answer: In light of the large sample size and prior pilot testing of presented images, results suggest that episodic migraineurs do not differentially attend to headache-related facial stimuli. Given modest evidence of attentional biases among chronic headache samples, these findings suggest potential differences in attentional processing between chronic and episodic headache subforms.

pred_answer: In men with low-risk prostate cancer, a longer treatment duration is associated with a higher risk of biochemical failure.
gold_answer: A proportionally longer treatment duration was identified as an adverse factor in low-risk patients. Treatment breaks resulting in a NTDR of>/=33% (e.g., four or more breaks during a 40-fraction treatment, 5 d/wk) should be avoided.

pred_answer: The results suggest that reactive strength may be more important than concentric muscle power for running speed with changes of direction.
gold_answer: The relationships between leg muscle power and change-of-direction speed were not consistent. Reactive strength as measured by the drop jump appears to have some importance for lateral change-of-direction speed, possibly because of similar push-off actions. It was concluded that reactive strength of the leg extensor muscles has some importance in change-of-direction performance but the other technical and perceptual factors than influence agility performance should also be considered.

pred_answer: No. The basal expression of most of the genes analyzed did not show a uniform pattern between women who subsequently became pregnant.
gold_answer: Our data suggest that very few genes, which change their expression level during the WOI, show a quantitative homogeneous expression in endometrially-receptive patients. In conclusion, in this study only six genes showed a homogeneous expression, and are probably involved in embryo implantation mechanisms.

pred_answer: Yes. The discharge coordinator improved the quality of discharge planning and reduced problems experienced by patients after discharge.
gold_answer: The introduction of a discharge coordinator improved the quality of discharge planning, but at additional cost.

pred_answer: No. We found no difference in 30-day readmission, band-related reoperation, or postoperative BMI/%EWL between patients with different numbers and locations of sutures.
gold_answer: Patients with fewer or anterior sutures have shorter OR times. However, 30-day readmission, band-related reoperation, and postoperative weight loss were unaffected by number or location of suture. The technical aspects of HHR did not appear to be associated with readmission or reoperation, and therefore a standardized approach may not be necessary.

pred_answer: Obesity is associated with increased injury severity and higher injury severity scores in children. However, it does not appear to affect the pattern of injury or the outcome of trauma in children.
gold_answer: Obesity does not seem to impact the severity of injury, mortality rate, types of injury, and procedure outcomes in children. Obese patients are more likely to have rib and pelvic injuries.

pred_answer: No. Our data suggest that vitamin D deficiency is not a feature of prepubertal children with CD. However, the vitamin D status of obese children with CD may be suboptimal.
gold_answer: Our data showed no difference in 25(OH) D levels between normal children and those with CD when adjusted for body mass index.

pred_answer: The occurrence of cerebromediastinal tuberculosis in a child with a probable Say-Barber-Miller syndrome is very rare. We discuss a possible link between this syndrome and the occurrence of tuberculosis.
gold_answer: [corrected] This observation is exceptional in many aspects: very early age of onset of extrapulmonary tuberculosis, no immune deficit, association with a rare congenital neurological syndrome. We discuss the possible link between this entity and the occurrence of tuberculosis.

pred_answer: Positron emission tomography scanning has a significant impact on the management of primary rectal cancer. It is an important tool in the assessment of rectal cancer and should be considered in all patients with advanced disease.
gold_answer: Position emission tomography scanning appears to accurately change the stage or appropriately alter the therapy of almost a third of patients with advanced primary rectal cancer. In view of this, we suggest that position emission tomography scanning be considered part of standard workup for such patients, particularly if neoadjuvant chemoradiation is being considered as part of primary management.

pred_answer: No. The APACHE II score is not a reliable marker of physiological impairment in emergency surgical patients.
gold_answer: For risk stratification in emergency surgical patients, it is essential to measure the APACHE II score before surgical treatment. Longitudinal APACHE II scoring reveals continuous improvement of the score in surviving patients but has no therapeutic relevance in the individual patient.

pred_answer: No. The use of an endoscope during VPS procedures does not appear to increase the incidence of infection.
gold_answer: In the present study, the use of an endoscope during VPS procedures did not increase the risk of surgical infection.

pred_answer: The increase in the number of cases of shigellosis in Barcelona has been observed since 2004, with a more marked increase in the last 5 years. This increase is mainly due to S. sonnei and S. flexneri, which are associated with homosexual transmission. The increase in
gold_answer: An increased trend was detected in men who had no history of food poisoning or travel to endemic areas. This increase points to a change in the pattern of shigellosis, becoming predominantly male and its main mechanism probably by sexual transmission.

pred_answer: Spontaneous remission of PAN has been reported in the literature but is rare. Our case suggests that spontaneous remission may occur in some patients with PAN. However, the exact mechanisms underlying this phenomenon remain unknown.
gold_answer: This case illustrates the importance of considering PAN in the differential diagnosis of renal infarction with inflammatory syndrome and shows that spontaneous remission of renal PAN can occur. .

pred_answer: Unanswerable.
gold_answer: We were unable to find in our institution data compatible to the presence of vancomycin MIC creep during the study period. This phenomenon seems not to be generalized; as a result each institution should systematically monitor MRSA vancomycin MIC over time.

pred_answer: No. Laboratories may report incorrect results for serum quantitative hCG assays. We recommend that laboratories use appropriate nomenclature when reporting results for serum quantitative hCG assays.
gold_answer: Many factors contribute to the erroneous reporting of hCG results, including (a) the complexity of hCG molecule and confusion of nomenclature on the various forms of hCG; (b) laboratory personnel's lack of awareness of the distinctions of the forms of hCG and failure to recognize the specificity of assays for their measurement; (c) lack of clarity and uniformity in manufacturers' reagent labeling; and (d) most product inserts' lack of information on the specificity of each method to the various forms of hCG.

pred_answer: Yes. WC and HC scaled to height in adults, and WC/height and HC/height scaled negatively to height. These findings suggest that WC/height and HC/height should be interpreted in the context of height.
gold_answer: Circumferences and related ratios scale significantly to height, notably after adjustment for age and race, across subjects who are representative of the US population. These observations have implications for the clinical and epidemiologic use of these anthropometric measures and indexes.

pred_answer: VEGF expression was significantly higher in patients with vena cava invasion than in those without vena cava invasion. VEGF expression was also significantly associated with survival in pT3 renal cell carcinoma.
gold_answer: Progression of a pT3 tumour into the renal vein and vena cava is not associated with increased tumour expression of VEGF. However, VEGF is an independent prognostic factor in this group of poor prognosis renal tumours.

pred_answer: No. The distribution of health care benefits in Kenya does not meet the principles of universal coverage. The private-for-profit sector remains pro-rich, while the public sector benefits show an equal distribution.
gold_answer: The principles of universal coverage require that all should benefit from health care according to need. The Kenyan health sector is clearly inequitable and benefits are not distributed on the basis of need. Deliberate efforts should be directed to restructuring the Kenyan health system to address access barriers and ensure that all Kenyans benefit from health care when they need it.

pred_answer: No. The presence of HCA on MRI does not appear to predict cognitive decline in AD, depression or cognitively unimpaired controls.
gold_answer: HCA was not found to be a predictor of subsequent cognitive decline in this series.

pred_answer: No. The obstetric history was well documented, but in no group was there a satisfactory response to a detected problem. The documentation of the other aspects of obstetric care was usually adequate, but no significant improvement was seen in the management of labour.
gold_answer: Completion of the obstetric manual of the PEP improved the knowledge of the midwives but no alteration in practice was detected.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the right hemisphere can develop adequate reading skills in the absence of the left hemisphere. The findings are consistent with the hypothesis that the right hemisphere can develop adequate phonological processing skills in the absence of the left hemisphere. However, the right hemisphere may not be able to develop adequate vocabulary size.
gold_answer: When cerebral hemispherectomy is performed to control seizures associated with very early (in utero) insult, it has been found that the remaining right hemisphere is still able to support reading and phonological processing skills that are normally mediated by the left hemisphere. Our results also suggest the existence of variability in individuals after hemispherectomy, even within groups having the same etiology and similar timing of insult.

pred_answer: No. The TEAM sample differed from the Phenomenology sample in several diagnostic characteristics.
gold_answer: Generalization of the RCT sample was supported, because only 7.8% of Phenomenology subjects did not fit the RCT criteria. Nevertheless, because the RCT subjects were more severely ill, it is unclear if treatment findings from the RCT will be applicable to children with less severe mania.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that CA72-4 is a useful biomarker in the differential diagnosis between ovarian endometrioma and ovarian cancer.
gold_answer: This study suggests that CA72-4 determination can be useful to confirm the benign nature of ovarian endometriomas in women with high CA125 levels.

pred_answer: Laparoscopic surgery decreases the risk of atrial fibrillation after foregut surgery.
gold_answer: Laparoscopic surgery is associated with lower risk of atrial fibrillation in foregut surgery. Development of atrial fibrillation is associated with increased length of intensive care stay. We recommend a prospective trial to confirm our findings.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that the hypoinsulinemic effect of alcohol may be more important when alcohol is consumed with meals than when it is consumed outside of meals.
gold_answer: Alcohol drinking during meals was inversely related with risk of acute MI, whereas alcohol drinking outside meals only was unrelated to risk.

pred_answer: The results suggest that the HINT1 gene may be a candidate for schizophrenia. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: : Data from both association and expression studies suggested that variants at HINT1 may be associated with schizophrenia and the associations may be sex-specific. However, the markers showing associations were in high LD to the SPEC2/PDZ-GEF2/ACSL6 locus reported previously in the same samples. This made it difficult to separate the association signals amongst these genes. Other independent studies may be necessary to distinguish these candidate genes.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that occupational exposure to arsenic may increase the risk of diabetes mellitus. However, the study has several limitations, including the lack of information on the level of exposure and the fact that the study was based on death certificates. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: The observations from this study provide limited support for the possibility that occupational arsenic exposure could play a role in the development of diabetes mellitus. Many other metallic compounds are also used in art glass production, however, and there is a possibility of confounding.

pred_answer: The presence of cervical cord plaques and cervical discopathy at the same site is more frequent than that at different sites in patients with MS. This finding suggests that the cervical cord plaques may be related to the cervical discopathy.
gold_answer: The study data suggests a possible correlation between cervical discopathy and cervical MS plaque.

pred_answer: Shaving the incision site before spinal surgery does not appear to increase the infection rate.
gold_answer: The shaving of the incision site immediately before spinal surgery may increase the rate of postoperative infection.

pred_answer: Yes. Physician underestimation of severity was more common among black patients, and was associated with poorer asthma care.
gold_answer: Biased estimates of asthma severity may contribute to racially disparate asthma care. Interventions to improve physicians' assessments of asthma severity and patient-physician communication may minimize racial disparities in asthma care.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that biofeedback training can significantly improve the psychophysiological control over competitive anxiety and enhance athletic performance.
gold_answer: One year following completion of the training program, all participants from the experimental group indicated that they were still using the biofeedback - psycho-regulation skills. Furthermore, these participants uniformly reported believing that these skills had enhanced their athletic performance and general well-being.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients with schizophrenia show progressive brain atrophy and ventricular enlargement over time.
gold_answer: These findings suggest that schizophrenia is associated with progressive structural brain abnormalities, affecting both gray and white matter. We found no evidence to suggest progressive medial temporal lobe involvement but did find evidence that this may be partly explained by heterogeneity between studies in patient age and illness duration. The causes and clinical correlates of these progressive brain changes should now be the focus of investigation.

pred_answer: The present study did not find any evidence of an association between HPV and pterygia.
gold_answer: The low presence of HPV DNA in pterygia does not support the hypothesis that HPV is involved in the development of pterygia in Denmark.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that a 9-month treatment is sufficient in tuberculous enterocolitis.
gold_answer: Tuberculous enterocolitis can be managed by 9-month chemotherapy without disease recurrence. Further investigations are needed in immunocompromised patients.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of this study suggest that laparoscopic reoperation for failed antireflux surgery is feasible.
gold_answer: Antireflux surgery failures are most commonly associated with hiatal herniation, followed by the breakdown of the fundoplication. The laparoscopic approach may be used successfully to treat patients with failed antireflux operations. Good results were achieved despite the technical difficulty of the procedures.

pred_answer: The clinical presentation of cutaneous melanoma in nonwhite persons is different from that of white persons. The prognosis of nonwhite patients with cutaneous melanoma is worse than that of white patients. These differences may be related to the fact that nonwhite patients present with more advanced disease.
gold_answer: In a multiethnic population, cutaneous melanoma in nonwhite persons is unusual but not rare. Although the diagnoses are distinctly different at initial examinations, suggesting a potential biological component, stage-for-stage outcomes are similar between white and nonwhite persons and suggest a need for early diagnostic interventions with unusual pigmented lesions in nonwhite persons.

pred_answer: No. In this large cohort of men without prostate cancer, body mass index was not significantly associated with prostate specific antigen after adjusting for age.
gold_answer: Consistent with prior studies, we found an inverse relationship between obesity and serum prostate specific antigen. However, the magnitude of the difference was small. Thus, adjusting prostate specific antigen for body mass index does not appear warranted.

pred_answer: Yes. The mortality rate in our study was 35.7% which is higher than that reported by other authors. We found that the presence of diabetes mellitus, leukocytosis, and the need for surgical intervention are associated with increased mortality.
gold_answer: The interval from the onset of clinical symptoms to the initial surgical intervention seems to be the most important prognostic factor with a significant impact on outcome. Despite extensive therapeutic efforts, Fournier's gangrene remains a surgical emergency and early recognition with prompt radical debridement is the mainstays of management.

pred_answer: Yes. Older drivers have more driving errors than younger drivers. Automatic transmission improves the driving behavior of older drivers.
gold_answer: Switching to automatic transmission may be recommended for older drivers as a means to maintain safe driving and thereby the quality of their transport mobility.

pred_answer: The present study shows that the majority of residents have poor health habits and are not vaccinated against some important diseases. This is a matter of concern because these residents will become the future leaders of the medical profession. We recommend that preventive medical visits should be mandatory for all residents and that the medical school should include a course on health
gold_answer: This study showed that our residents did not always have a healthy lifestyle especially when it comes to physical activity and eating habits. They also lacked an adequate vaccination. Interventions should take place in order to promote healthy life style and to improve their vaccination status.

pred_answer: No. The erosive potential of SF medicines is similar to that of their SC bioequivalents.
gold_answer: Paediatric SF medicines were not more erosive than SC medicines in vitro; a more significant predictor of their erosive potential was dose form.

pred_answer: Yes. The use of SPI as a non-invasive method for the prediction of esophageal varices in patients with compensated hepatic cirrhosis is feasible.
gold_answer: The SPI was accurate in predicting the presence or absence of esophageal varices in patients with compensated cirrhosis.

pred_answer: No. The results of this study show that single-agent mitoxantrone is as effective as combination chemotherapy in terms of response, remission duration, time to response, time to best response, time to progression and overall survival.
gold_answer: No significant difference was detected between the treatment with mitoxantrone as a single agent and the combination of low-dose FEC in terms of response or survival; therefore, the imperative of the necessity of first-line combination chemotherapy for patients with high-risk metastatic breast cancer may be questioned. Since toxicity and quality of life score favored the single-agent mitoxantrone treatment arm, this treatment may be offered to patients preferring quality of life to a potential small prolongation of survival.

pred_answer: No. The present study did not find any association between arch form and either Bolton discrepancy or sagittal molar relationship.
gold_answer: Arch form in a Saudi patient group is independent of gender, sagittal molar relationship, and Bolton discrepancy.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that intraoperative neuromonitoring may be beneficial for patients undergoing TME.
gold_answer: In this study TME with IONM was associated with significant lower rates of urinary and anorectal dysfunction. Prospective randomized trials are mandatory to evaluate the definite role of IONM in rectal cancer surgery.

pred_answer: Halitosis is significantly associated with high BUN levels and low salivary flow rates in ESRD patients. PD therapy may improve halitosis by lowering BUN levels and increasing salivary flow rates.
gold_answer: High BUN levels and low salivary flow rates were found to be associated with halitosis. PD may play an important role in decreasing the level of halitosis in ESRD patients.

pred_answer: Smoking, alcohol consumption, and waist circumference are independent predictors of the development of hypertension in Black South Africans. These findings suggest that lifestyle modification may be an important strategy to prevent the development of hypertension in this population.
gold_answer: During the 5 years, 24% of Africans with optimal BP developed hypertension. The surge in hypertension in Africa is largely explained by modifiable risk factors. Public health strategies should focus aggressively on lifestyle to prevent a catastrophic burden on the national health system.

pred_answer: No. The results show that the algorithms are not sufficiently sensitive to be used as a sole tool for causality assessment. They can be used as a first step in the evaluation process but should be followed by a more detailed analysis.
gold_answer: Decisional algorithms are sensitive methods for the detection of ADRs, but they present poor specificity. A reference method was not identified. Algorithms do not replace GI and are not definite alternatives in the individual causality assessment of suspected ADRs.

pred_answer: No. The route of delivery does not appear to influence maternal and perinatal outcomes in women with eclampsia.
gold_answer: A policy of early cesarean delivery in eclampsia, carrying ≥34 weeks, is not associated with better outcomes.

pred_answer: The results suggest that unicompartmental knee replacement does not affect knee kinematics. This finding supports the hypothesis that unicompartmental knee replacement can be used in younger, active patients without compromising the normal knee kinematics.
gold_answer: In this in vitro cadaver study, the tricompartmental replacement significantly changed knee kinematics while the unicompartmental replacement preserved normal knee kinematics.

pred_answer: The beta1Gly49 polymorphism in the TTN gene and the ADRB2 gene haplotype may play a role in the pathogenesis of TTN.
gold_answer: We conclude that beta1Gly49 homozygosity and TACC haplotype of ADRB2 gene, both loss-of-function genetic variations, may predispose to TTN.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the CYP2D6*4 allele may be associated with a decreased risk of breast cancer in the Spanish population. Further studies are needed to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: A possible decreased transformation of procarcinogens by CYP2D6*4 poor metabolisers could result in a protective effect against carcinogens.

pred_answer: No. The prognosis of patients with direct mesocolon invasion is better than those with other T4 factors. Therefore, we suggest that direct mesocolon invasion should not be included in T4 for the staging of gastric cancer.
gold_answer: Mesocolon invasion should be included in T4 for the staging of gastric cancer.

pred_answer: We conclude that the introduction of the DH guidance has been associated with improved survival in gynaecological cancer patients in the Anglia region of England.
gold_answer: The adoption of the 1999 guidance on gynaecological cancer, which included multidisciplinary case management and centralisation of surgery, resulted in a marked step-change improvement in survival of gynaecological cancer in an area of eastern England in 2000.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that combined therapy with hyperbaric oxygen and GH is more effective than GH or hyperbaric oxygen alone in the healing of ischemic and non-ischemic colonic anastomoses.
gold_answer: Combined treatment with recombinant human growth hormone and hyperbaric oxygen resulted in a favorable therapeutic effect on the healing of ischemic colonic anastomoses.

pred_answer: The available evidence does not support the hypothesis that appendiceal perforation is a risk factor for tubal infertility or ectopic pregnancy.
gold_answer: The methodologic weaknesses of the studies do not permit acceptance of increased risk of tubal pregnancy or infertility as a consequence of perforation of the appendix, so a causal relationship cannot be supported by the data currently available. Only a well-designed case-control study with unbiased ascertainment of exposure and adjustment for confounding variables will provide a definitive answer.

pred_answer: The present study suggests that the D allele of ACE gene may be a risk factor for CKD among hypertensive patients. Further studies are required to confirm these findings.
gold_answer: It is concluded that ACE-DD genotype may be a risk factor for the causation and development of chronic kidney failure among hypertensive patients.

pred_answer: Emergency DBE is a feasible and safe procedure in patients with overt OGIB. The combined approach with RT viewing by CE may improve the diagnostic yield of DBE.
gold_answer: Emergency DBE is feasible, safe and effective in acute OGIB and may avoid major surgery, diagnosing and successfully treating most patients. Combined approach with RT viewing by CE is especially useful to identify recurrent bleeding vascular lesions such as DL that may be easily misdiagnosed by non-emergency DBE.

pred_answer: The prevalence of the Streptococcus agalactiae in the pregnant women from Melilla is 15.71%. There is no significant difference between the cultures, but there is a significant difference between the ages. The prevalence is higher in the women under 25 years old.
gold_answer: The prevalence of vagino-rectal colonization by Streptococcus group B in the pregnant women from Melilla is within the national estimated figures, however it is different if they are from Muslim or Christian culture, being higher in the Muslim population. On one hand both prevalences are within the national statistics, and on the other hand it is observed that there is not any difference according to age.

pred_answer: No. The bedside assessment has a low sensitivity for detecting aspiration and therefore cannot be relied upon to exclude aspiration.
gold_answer: Bedside assessment of swallowing lacks the necessary sensitivity to be used as a screening instrument in acute stroke, but there are concerns about the use of videofluoroscopy as a gold standard. The relative importance of aspiration and bedside assessment in predicting complications and outcome needs to be studied.

pred_answer: The prevalence of elevated RHR in this rural population was high. Elevated RHR was associated with casual high BP and may be a useful marker of CVD risk in this population.
gold_answer: Significant associations were observed between RHR and several established cardiovascular risk factors. Prospective studies are needed in sub-Saharan African populations to establish the potential value of RHR in cardiovascular risk assessment.

pred_answer: The use of quilting suture in abdominoplasty does not prevent seroma. However, it can be used to reduce the volume of seroma.
gold_answer: The quilting suture seems to be an efficient technique with which to prevent seroma formation.

pred_answer: Unenhanced T1-W fat-saturated MRI does not reliably differentiate bone infarcts from acute osteomyelitis in children with SCD.
gold_answer: The bone marrow signal intensity on unenhanced T1-W fat-saturated MR images is not a reliable criterion to differentiate bone infarcts from osteomyelitis in children.

pred_answer: The majority of MDT decisions were concordant with subsequent patient management. However, a minority of decisions were discordant, which may have been due to patient choice, additional information available after the MDT or MDT error.
gold_answer: The vast majority of MDT decisions are implemented. Management alteration was most often due to patient choice or additional information available after the MDT. A minority of management alterations were 'unjustifiable' and the authors recommend that any patient whose treatment is subsequently changed should have MDT rediscussion prior to treatment.

pred_answer: No. The results suggest that medical providers will continue to prescribe focus medications even when provided with education and counter samples.
gold_answer: Education by pharmacists, combined with access to counter samples, may or may not have an effect on medical provider prescribing, depending on the category of medication targeted for cost control.

pred_answer: No. Fruit and vegetable consumption is low in the Netherlands, and there are significant socioeconomic inequalities in fruit and vegetable consumption. However, household and food shopping environmental factors do not appear to contribute to these inequalities.
gold_answer: Improving access to FV in the household and food shopping environments will only make a small contribution to improving population consumption levels, and may only have a limited effect in reducing socioeconomic inequalities in their consumption.

pred_answer: Exercise training reduces the QT/RR slope in both genders, but this effect is more pronounced in women.
gold_answer: The results of this study suggest that the cardiovascular response to exercise training may be different in men and women. Women may benefit more from interventions aimed to increase physical activity as a tool for prevention of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.

pred_answer: The development of a real-time PCR-based system for the identification and quantification of airborne allergenic pollen taxa is feasible. This approach could be used to improve the current aerobiological monitoring systems.
gold_answer: The real-time PCR approach revealed promising results in pollen identification and quantification, even when analyzing pollen mixes. Future perspectives could concern the development of multiplex real-time PCR for the simultaneous detection of different taxa in the same reaction tube and the application of high-throughput molecular methods.

pred_answer: Yes. The biochemical markers of bone formation and resorption are representative of the histomorphometric parameters of bone turnover in postmenopausal women.
gold_answer: Bone turnover markers were significantly but modestly associated with bone turnover parameters measured in iliac cancellous bone. The iliac crest bone may not represent perfectly the whole bone turnover.

pred_answer: No. Risk factors for suicidal behavior did not differ by polarity.
gold_answer: Bipolarity does not independently influence risk of suicidal behavior or alter the influence of well-established suicide risk factors within affective disorders. Suicide risk assessment strategies may continue to appraise these common risk factors without regard to mood polarity.

pred_answer: The use of hydrophilic guidewires significantly improves the technical success rate of PTA in iliac and SFA occlusions.
gold_answer: In summary, we report an overall improvement and high technical success rate for peripherial PTA. The use of hydrophilic guidewires made significant difference to the technical success rate of PTA, especially in occlusion and more complicated lesions.

pred_answer: Yes. The urinary biomarkers assessment is a non-invasive approach to tubular lesions of the solitary kidney.
gold_answer: Urinary biomarkers allow a non-invasive, sensitive, early assessment of the tubular lesions of the SK. Urinary biomarkers of PT injury parallel renal function decline, thus complementing the estimation of GFR. Monitoring of PT dysfunction is mandatory in patients with SK.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that case-mix based reimbursement stimulates the development of care programmes, but not yet the development of process-oriented care delivery. The findings of this study are important for policy makers who aim at improving the quality of care by stimulating the development of care programmes and process-oriented care delivery.
gold_answer: This study demonstrates that hospital management can stimulate the development of care programmes by the adoption of case-mix reimbursement within hospitals' budgeting processes. Future research is recommended to confirm this finding and to determine whether the establishment of care programmes will in time indeed lead to a more process-oriented view of professionals.

pred_answer: No. Older adults were able to learn and use effective encoding strategies on a reading span task, but this training did not improve their performance on a paired-associate recall task.
gold_answer: Strategy training can boost WM performance, and its benefits appear to arise from strategy-specific effects and not from domain-general gains in cognitive ability.

pred_answer: Yes. QTcD is a simple non-invasive method that can predict LVH in hypertensive patients.
gold_answer: QTcD is significantly increased in hypertensive patients with LVH compared with those without, being strongly correlated with the indices of LVH. A QTcD cut-off value of 60 ms predicted LVH in hypertensive patients with a high sensitivity and specificity.

pred_answer: The use of Google as a diagnostic tool in difficult immunological and allergologic cases is not reliable.
gold_answer: This Google-based search was useful to identify an appropriate diagnosis in complex immunological and allergic cases. Computing skills may help to get better results.

pred_answer: The 30-day data are useful for identifying hospitals with high or low mortality rates, but they do not provide a complete picture of hospital performance. The 31-180-day data add important information about hospital performance.
gold_answer: Using data on cumulative hospital mortality from 180 days postadmission does not yield a different perspective from using data from 30 days postadmission for the conditions we studied.

pred_answer: The results support the hypothesis that some U.S. states have higher/lower injury mortality rates than others.
gold_answer: Group 1 states are likely to exhibit above-average rates for most other categories of injury death, whereas group 2 states are even more likely to exhibit below-average rates for most other categories of injury death.

For scientific purposes and when in doubt, it remains necessary to review the computer-generated data manually to discover every gastropharyngeal reflux event.

pred_answer: Yes. The proportion of thin melanomas is increasing, while the proportion of thicker melanomas is decreasing. This suggests that public awareness campaigns have been successful in encouraging people to seek medical advice earlier.

This may be a result of increased public awareness due to effective public health campaigns which has significant prognostic and financial implications.

pred_answer: Expert breast pathology assessment is necessary for the management of DCIS.
gold_answer: Expert breast pathology assessments continue to be necessary in the management of DCIS.

gold_answer: LF and cruroplasty is feasible and has good results in terms of GERD symptoms control and additional weight loss. The high rate of postoperative complications observed in this series remains a matter of concern. A re-sleeve procedure might be considered as an alternative to RYGB/DS conversion restricted to selected patients.

pred_answer: Laparoscopic-assisted ileocolic resections can be performed successfully in patients with Crohn's disease who have abscesses, phlegmons, or recurrent disease at the previous ileocolic anastomosis.
gold_answer: The laparoscopic-assisted approach to Crohn's disease is feasible and safe with good outcomes. Co-morbid preoperative findings such as abscess, phlegmon, or recurrent disease at the previous ileocolic anastomosis are not contraindications to a successful laparoscopic-assisted ileocolic resection in select patients.

pred_answer: The model suggests that maximal healing of reflux oesophagitis is achieved when intragastric pH>4 is achieved for approximately 50-70% of the 24-h period.

pred_answer: No. The growth rate of a gallbladder polyp is not a useful predictor of a neoplastic polyp.
gold_answer: Patient's age (>60 y) and large polyp size (>10 mm) were significant predictive factors for neoplastic GB polyps. GB polyps less than 10 mm in diameter do not require surgical intervention simply because they grow.

pred_answer: No. The differences in causes of maternal deaths in different settings are not due to differences in wealth but rather to differences in the underlying health system and the availability of care.
gold_answer: Differences in maternal mortality are more than just differences between the rich and poor. However, there is no single, general solution to reduce maternal mortality, and identification of problems needs to be promoted through audit, both national and local.

pred_answer: The tibial motor response is more reliable than the peroneal motor response for predicting the success rate of a parasacral sciatic nerve block.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that the presence of a GP hospital reduces the utilisation of general hospital beds. This may be due to the fact that GP hospitals are more accessible to the local population and can provide a wider range of services than general hospitals.

pred_answer: Yes. Breast cancer survival has improved over time, even when adjusting for other prognostic factors.

gold_answer: The geriatric oncology consultation led to a modification of the cancer treatment plan in more than one third of cases. Further studies are needed to determine whether these modifications improve the outcome of these older patients.

gold_answer: Urbanicity was associated with increases in behavioral and physiological risk factors. However, these associations may not translate directly into increases in biological risk factors. The treatment outcome does not seem to be capable of improvement by increasing the apical dose. An internationally accepted model for defining the dosage in brachytherapy is needed.

pred_answer: Yes. Endoscopic splenectomy can be performed using a flexible endoscope. This technique may be useful for splenectomy in patients who are not candidates for laparoscopic surgery.

pred_answer: Yes. EMS professionals believe that they should participate in disease prevention.
gold_answer: The majority of EMS professionals thought that they should participate in disease and injury prevention programs. gold_answer: The fall rate was higher in older adults with cancer than in older adults without cancer.

gold_answer: Retinal haemorrhages following a convulsive episode are rare. Such a finding should trigger an extensive search for other reasons, including child abuse.

To avoid the risk for the donor in LRT, SLT represents the first-line therapy in pediatric liver transplantation in countries where cadaveric organs are available. LRT provides a solution for urgent cases in which a cadaveric graft cannot be found in time or if the choice of the optimal time point for transplantation is vital.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that sparing of one parotid gland can prevent xerostomia. However, the number of patients in this study is small and further studies are needed to confirm these findings.

gold_answer: Our findings support the importance of increasing access to clinical services, certain outreach services and breastfeeding and, in Africa, of improving nutritional status. Integrated programs that emphasize these services may lead to substantial mortality declines.

gold_answer: Although some differences existed, RD and RN CDEs are making similar overall recommendations in the treatment of individuals with diabetes.

pred_answer: Yes. Knee extensor strength, dynamic stability, and functional ambulation are all related in PD.

In addition, HSKs could potentially optimize the use of genitourinary medicine services and facilitate patient choice.

pred_answer: In the elderly, vaccine protection is frequently insufficient. The reasons for this are not only the lack of vaccination according to recommendations, but also a low antibody concentration and a short duration of protective humoral immunity.
gold_answer: The data demonstrate that vaccination has a relatively weak and short-lasting effect in old age. The results of the study should stimulate discussions about strategies how vaccinations can be made more effective in old age. Improved campaigns, shortened vaccination intervals as well as the design of novel vaccines tailored to fulfill the specific demands of the aging immune system are imaginable.

gold_answer: Low rectal resection during debulking procedures for gynaecological cancers with peritoneal carcinomatosis can safely be performed by an experienced surgeon without a diverting stoma.

gold_answer: Our data suggest that UHR intake criteria predict transition over 6 months in the order of Trait alone<APS<BLIPS. The fact that BLIPS patients are at the highest risk of transition over the short term is consistent with the "early" versus "late" prodrome model. It also indicates that particular clinical attention may need to be paid to BLIPS patients, especially early in the course of treatment.

gold_answer: Among patients receiving MMT and medical care at different sites, documentation of opioid dependence and MMT in the medical record occurs for the majority, but is missing in a substantial number of patients. Most of these patients are prescribed medications that potentially interact with methadone. This study highlights opportunities for improved coordination between medical care and MMT.

pred_answer: Yes. Chest wall rigidity is a known complication of fentanyl overdose. This study provides evidence that chest wall rigidity may be a factor in rapid death from illicit fentanyl abuse.
gold_answer: In summary we believe sudden onset chest wall rigidity may be a significant and previously unreported factor leading to an increased mortality, from illicit IV fentanyl use. Fentanyl and norfentanyl ratios and concentrations suggest a more rapid onset of death given the finding of fentanyl without norfentanyl in many of the fatalities. Chest wall rigidity may help explain the cause of death in these instances, in contrast to the typical opioid-related overdose deaths. Intravenous heroin users should be educated regarding this potentially fatal complication given the increasingly common substitution and combination with heroin of fentanyl.

gold_answer: This illustrates that Paget's disease does exist in India and a high index of suspicion is required to clinch the diagnosis.
