gold_answer: There is little evidence that the 2008 public antibiotic campaigns were effective. The use and visibility of future campaign materials needs auditing. A carefully planned approach that targets the public in GP waiting rooms and through clinicians in consultations may be a more effective way of improving prudent antibiotic use.

pred_answer: No. In this sample of elderly patients living in nursing homes, the presence of PAD was not associated with increased risk of death.
gold_answer: The prevalence of PAD is high in nursing home residents. AAI is not predictive for IHD mortality in this population. In very frail elderly traditional risk factors and PAD are less important predictors of death compared to poor functional status, nutritional factors and previous cardiovascular disease.

pred_answer: Yes. Ultrasound performed in the third trimester can accurately predict the presentation of the first twin at delivery.
gold_answer: The presentation of the first twin at delivery can be determined by sonogram by the 32nd week of gestation in over 90% of twin pregnancies.

pred_answer: The results suggest that there is some variability in the effectiveness of therapists delivering CPT. The supervisor's ratings of the therapists' effectiveness were associated with the therapist's ability to address patient avoidance, use of language in supervision, interpersonal flexibility, and development of a strong therapeutic alliance. These findings have implications for training and supervision of
gold_answer: This study adds to the growing body of literature documenting the importance of the individual therapist as an important factor in the change process.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Although the estimated effective dose is low for VCUG radiographic scout images, this step did not augment VCUG interpretation or contribute management-changing information. This step should be omitted or substituted to further reduce dose in pediatric VCUG.

pred_answer: The presence of the FAC in the lavage fluid suggests that it may be a useful marker of inflammation in cervical disk disease.
gold_answer: Biochemical analysis of injured cervical intervertebral disks reveals the presence of inflammatory markers such as MCP, fragments of structural matrix proteins such as FAC, and a correlation with pH. Further evaluation of the FAC as a potential diagnostic biomarker or therapeutic target is warranted in the cervical spine.

pred_answer: Second-look laparotomy is not recommended for patients with advanced EOC who are clinically free of disease after primary surgery and platinum-based chemotherapy.
gold_answer: The second-look laparotomy doesn't have a favorable impact on overall and disease-free survival. Tumor grade is the only independent prognostic variable for survival of the patients.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that the processing of affective prosody is modulated by spatial attention.
gold_answer: Emotional prosody, therefore, seems to be partially processed outside the focus of spatial attention. Whereas at early sensory processing stages spatial attention modulates the degree of emotional voice processing as a function of emotional valence, emotional prosody is processed outside of the focus of spatial attention at later processing stages.

pred_answer: No. Early postoperative oral intake is safe after laparotomy and colorectal resection.
gold_answer: Early oral intake is possible after laparotomy and colorectal resection. Thus, the laparoscopic surgeon's claim of early tolerated oral intake may not be unique to laparoscopy.

pred_answer: Routine follow-up procedures are not able to detect all asymptomatic recurrences. However, the use of these procedures may be useful to identify some asymptomatic recurrences and to improve the survival of patients with endometrial cancer.
gold_answer: Follow-up after endometrial cancer treatment varies in Italy. In this retrospective study, women with asymptomatic recurrence have shown a better clinical outcome compared with those with symptomatic relapse. The optimal approach is actually unknown, and guidelines comparing follow-up protocols have not been established. Prospective cost-effectiveness studies are needed.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Despite current recommendations, cough and cold medicines are still used in children younger than 6 years of age. A significant portion of caregivers report that they are still unaware of public warnings, potential side effects, and interactions with other medications.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients with well-controlled gastro-oesophageal reflux disease who undergo laparoscopic antireflux surgery for the indication of patient preference experience significant improvement in quality of life.
gold_answer: Laparoscopic antireflux surgery significantly improved quality of life in reflux patients whose symptoms were well controlled on medical therapy. Although on the basis of a noncomparative trial with a relatively short follow-up period, we believe such patients should be considered for laparoscopic antireflux surgery.

pred_answer: No. Delay in transfer to a rehabilitation unit does not appear to affect outcome for older people with fracture of the proximal femur.
gold_answer: Delay in transfer to a rehabilitation ward was associated with a disproportionate increase in total hospital length of stay for patients aged over 75 with fracture of the proximal femur.

pred_answer: Lay people and health professionals differ in their views on whether a physician should breach confidentiality to protect a patient's wife from a sexually transmitted disease. Lay people and psychologists are more likely to accept breaching confidentiality than are physicians.
gold_answer: Most people in France are influenced by situational factors when deciding if a physician should breach confidentiality to protect the spouse of a patient infected with STD.

pred_answer: In patients with SSS, a side-to-side difference in systolic blood pressure is significantly higher in patients with complete reversal and alternating flow than in those with systolic deceleration. This suggests that the degree of vertebral artery stenosis may be reflected in the waveform type.
gold_answer: Brachial systolic blood pressure difference is related to the severity of SSS and can be used as a screening tool for SSS. However, it performed better in severe steal than milder steal phenomena.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that maternal creatine homeostasis is altered during pregnancy in the spiny mouse. The data indicate that the maternal kidney is a major site of creatine synthesis during pregnancy, with increased renal AGAT and GAMT expression and activity. These changes may reflect a requirement for increased creatine synthesis
gold_answer: Change of maternal creatine status (increased creatine synthesis and reduced creatine excretion) may be a necessary adjustment of maternal physiology to pregnancy to meet the metabolic demands of maternal tissues, the placenta and developing fetus.

pred_answer: No. The presence of antiphospholipid antibodies does not appear to be a risk factor for the development of AVN in SLE.
gold_answer: Incorporating an adjustment for corticosteroid use we were unable to show a link between the presence of aPL and the development of AVN in patients with SLE.

pred_answer: Liquid-based preparations have higher concordance rates with reference diagnoses than classic preparations. The differences are most pronounced for HGUCA.
gold_answer: Liquid-based preparations performed significantly better in urinary cytology challenges when evaluating malignant categories in the College of American Pathologists interlaboratory comparison program. The liquid-based preparation challenges also performed better for the exact reference interpretation of HGUCA, but no difference was observed for adenocarcinoma challenges. Cytotechnologists perform better than pathologists for all slide types, as well as those demonstrating HGUCA. These results suggest that liquid-based preparations facilitate a more accurate diagnosis than conventional preparations.

pred_answer: SLBM is a simple, inexpensive, and noninvasive method that can be used to measure mesopic pupil size. However, its accuracy is limited by the observer's experience and the quality of the slit-lamp biomicroscopy image.
gold_answer: Although the SLBM is quite repeatable, it underestimates mesopic pupil size and shows a too wide range of agreement with CIP. SLBM shows low sensitivity in detecting pupils larger than 6 mm, which may be misleading when planning anterior segment surgery. Previous grading-consensus training strategies may increase interrater reproducibility, and compensation for the systematic underestimation could improve accuracy of the SLBM.

pred_answer: No. The acute changes in HR by isoproterenol did not affect the aortic stiffness in patients with hypertension.
gold_answer: Aortic stiffness was not affected by acute changes in HR produced by isoproterenol which suggests that it is not necessary to consider acute changes in HR when measuring aortic PWV.

pred_answer: Emergency ultrasound fellowship programs may improve residents' US education by increasing the number of US examinations performed and the scope of bedside US applications.
gold_answer: Emergency US fellowship programs had a positive impact on residents' US educational experiences. Emergency medicine residents performed more scans overall and also used bedside US for more advanced applications in programs with EUS fellowships.

pred_answer: The MASCC risk index score is a useful tool for risk stratifying gynecologic oncology patients with NF. Patients with a high MASCC score are at increased risk for complications and death.
gold_answer: Based on this pilot data, MASCC score appears promising in determining suitability for outpatient management of NF in gynecologic oncology patients. Prospective study is ongoing to confirm safety and determine impact on cost.

pred_answer: No. The biomechanical and wound healing characteristics of corneas after excimer laser keratorefractive surgery are different between advanced surface ablation and sub-Bowman's keratomileusis.
gold_answer: Ophthalmic pathology and basic science research show that SBK and ASA are improvements in excimer laser keratorefractive surgery compared to conventional LASIK or PRK, particularly with regard to maintaining corneal biomechanics and perhaps moderately reducing the risk of corneal haze. However, most of the disadvantages caused by wound healing issues remain.

pred_answer: No. The unfavourable prognostic importance of tumor depth is mainly due to the close association between tumor size and depth.
gold_answer: Most of the prognostic value of tumor depth in soft tissue sarcomas of the extremity or trunk wall can be explained by the association between tumor size and depth.

pred_answer: Risk factors for first lifetime-onset and recurrent MDD differ. The risk profile for first lifetime-onset MDD includes health conditions and psychosocial factors. Recurrence is associated with menopausal status, psychological symptoms and a prior anxiety disorder. These findings suggest that screening for MDD should be tailored to the individual
gold_answer: The menopausal transition warrants attention as a period of vulnerability to MDD recurrence, while health factors and VMS should be considered important risk factors for first lifetime-onset of MDD during midlife.

pred_answer: The prevalence of chronic conditions increased among Medicare Part A beneficiaries between 2008 and 2010. The increase was greater for dual-eligible beneficiaries than for nondual-eligible beneficiaries. The increase in the prevalence of chronic conditions was due to an increase in the prevalence of some chronic conditions and a decrease
gold_answer: Analyzing the prevalence of 11 chronic conditions by using Medicare claims data provides a monitoring tool that can guide health care providers and policy makers in devising strategies to address chronic conditions and rising health care costs.

pred_answer: In healthy adults at risk of developing Type 2 diabetes, there is a significant relationship between aerobic fitness and microvascular function. This may indicate that the development of impaired microvascular function is a consequence of reduced physical activity.
gold_answer: In this 'at-risk' group with skin microvascular dysfunction maximal oxygen uptake was not reduced compared with healthy controls. However, in the 'at-risk' group alone, individuals with higher levels of aerobic fitness also had better microvascular and endothelial responsiveness.

pred_answer: Our data suggest that QC is feasible and safe with acceptable morbidity and mortality rates. However, the extent of tumour resection remains a key determinant of survival.
gold_answer: Even in this highly advanced setting of the third EOC relapse, maximal therapeutic effort combining optimal surgery and chemotherapy appear to significantly prolong survival in a selected patients 'group'.

pred_answer: Local control rates for buccal mucosal cancer are poor, even when surgical margins are negative. This may be due to the high rate of T3-T4 disease in this group. In addition, the majority of patients in this series did not receive adjuvant therapy. Further studies are needed to determine whether ad
gold_answer: Local excision of T1 and T2 buccal mucosa cancers with pathologically negative margins had a high rate of local recurrence in our series. Low T-stage and negative margins are not adequate predictors of local control. Even early buccal tumors may benefit from adjuvant therapy to enhance local control.

pred_answer: No. The use of statins before stroke was associated with a trend toward better clinical outcome, but this association was not statistically significant.
gold_answer: The statistical power of this case-referent study was such that only large beneficial effects of statins in acute stroke could be confirmed. However, the observed trend, together with experimental observations, is interesting enough to warrant a more detailed analysis of the relationship between statins and stroke outcome.

pred_answer: Vitamin C can prevent complex regional pain syndrome in elderly women with wrist fractures.
gold_answer: Vitamin C reduces the prevalence of complex regional pain syndrome after wrist fractures. A daily dose of 500 mg for fifty days is recommended.

pred_answer: No. The APT with HDM is not specific for AD. In fact, the APT with HDM is positive in a significant number of non-AD subjects.
gold_answer: These observations lead to conclude that the APT with HDM is positive also in non-AD subjects but it is probably more specific for AD.

pred_answer: In this study, 8% of women with synchronous endometrial and ovarian cancers had molecular evidence of a germline mutation of MSH2 or MLH1. These data suggest that women with synchronous endometrial and ovarian cancers should be considered for genetic counseling and testing.
gold_answer: Overall, 7% of women in our cohort met either clinical or molecular criteria for Lynch syndrome. All of these women had a prior history or a first-degree relative with an HNPCC-associated cancer. Limiting genetic evaluation to women with synchronous endometrial and ovarian cancer who have a family history suggestive of HNPCC may appropriately identify women with Lynch syndrome.

pred_answer: No. Falls risk was poorly identified in discharge documentation. There was limited evidence of assessment for osteoporosis, footwear and visual assessment in the previous 2 years. There was also limited evidence that these risk factors were addressed in discharge planning.
gold_answer: There was little evidence that people at high risk of falls received systematic falls risk assessment during rehabilitation. When a risk was identified, generally a strategy was implemented. However, failure to assess some risk factors might have limited fall prevention strategies offered. Failure to adequately address risks during hospitalization could contribute to falls post-discharge. Geriatr Gerontol Int 2016; 16: 570-576.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that some aspects of social exclusion may have an impact on suicide mortality. The 'economic/employment' and 'social/welfare' dimensions of social exclusion are associated with suicide mortality. The 'social/welfare' dimension has a stronger influence on female suicide mortality than the 'economic/employment'
gold_answer: Both 'economic/employment' and 'social/welfare' dimensions of social exclusion significantly influence suicide mortality among males. The influence of 'economic/employment' and 'social/welfare' dimensions of social exclusion on female suicide mortality is controversial. Social exclusion might be considered as a risk factor for suicide mortality in Europe.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of this study suggest that mental imagery fMRI can be used to predict recovery in patients with disorders of consciousness.
gold_answer: The fMRI paradigm mental imagery displays a high concordance with the further clinical course of patients in a VS. All 5 patients in a VS who showed significant activation of ROIs had a favorable further course until the end of the observation period. We therefore propose the term "functional minimally conscious state" for these patients. They may benefit from rehabilitation treatment. In cases where no significant activation was seen, the method has no prognostic value. Prediction of the clinical course of patients in an MCS by fMRI was considerably less accurate than in patients in a VS.

pred_answer: Pancreas retransplantation is a safe procedure that can be offered to patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus and end-stage renal disease.
gold_answer: Pancreas retransplantation is a safe procedure with acceptable graft survival that should be proposed to diabetic patients who have lost their primary graft.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients treated via GES had significantly better outcomes in terms of symptom improvement, healthcare resource utilization and cost savings when compared with patients treated via MED.
gold_answer: We conclude that GES is more effective in improving long-term GI symptoms and costs, and decreasing use of healthcare resources than intensive medical therapy, in this sample of patients with the symptoms of GP followed for 3 years. Certain patients with GP form a high-risk group in terms of costs, quality of life, morbidity and mortality.

pred_answer: Yes. The patients receiving written information recalled more of the information given during the consent interview.
gold_answer: Written information sheets contribute to the process of informed consent. As patients' recall of information is generally poor, the sheets may also be useful medicolegally, as a permanent record of what was discussed.

pred_answer: The results of this study show that the use of CT attenuation values to identify urinary stone types is not reliable. This is due to the fact that the mean CT attenuation values of some stone types are significantly different from one CT scanner to another. These differences may be related to the different energy spectra used by the different CT scanners
gold_answer: According to our study, there is a great variability when different brands and models of scanners are compared directly. Furthermore, the CT scan analysis and HU evaluation appears to gather insufficient information in order to characterize and identify the composition of renal stones.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: Current K/DOQI guidelines are inadequate for correcting VDDI or secondary hyperparathyroidism in CKD patients. Future studies should examine the effects of higher or more frequent dosing of ergocalciferol on these clinical endpoints.

pred_answer: No. The ultrasonographic examination is not useful in the evaluation of boys with an undescended testis.
gold_answer: Sonography has no place in the diagnosis of undescended testis.

pred_answer: In NIDDM subjects, the DD genotype was associated with increased insulin sensitivity and decreased levels of des 31,32 proinsulin. These findings suggest that the DD genotype may be associated with insulin resistance. However, in nondiabetic subjects, there were no differences in insulin sensitivity, levels of insulin-like
gold_answer: We conclude that increased cardiovascular risk of the DD genotype is not mediated through insulin resistance or abnormalities in fibrinolysis. Conversely, we report an increased sensitivity in NIDDM subjects with the ACE DD genotype.

pred_answer: The combination of an HIZ and disc contour abnormalities may be useful in predicting concordant pain provocation during discography.
gold_answer: The proposed MR classification is useful to predict a disc with concordant pain. Disc protrusion with HIZ on MR imaging predicted positive discography in patients with discogenic low back pain.

pred_answer: No. Patients with OSA have a higher VO2max than the general population. This may be due to the chronic hypoxemia associated with OSA.
gold_answer: Overall, in a US Air Force population, OSA does not predict a decrease in aerobic fitness as measured by cycle ergometry. However, patients with an apnea-hypopnea index of greater than 20 have a statistically significant decrease in aerobic fitness compared to the normal population. This study demonstrates the effects of OSA on aerobic fitness. Further correlation of fitness testing results with OSA severity and treatment is needed.

pred_answer: The VMPA to the TMJ can improve access and reduce complications.
gold_answer: The VMPA can provide direct access and favorable visibility to the TMJ region and yield good esthetic and functional results. The VMPA can be considered the approach of choice for common TMJ surgeries.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the (.)Vo(2)peak measured during a treadmill test is a true reflection of the (.)Vo(2)max in children who have spina bifida and are ambulatory.
gold_answer: The (.)Vo(2)peak measured during an incremental treadmill test seems to reflect the true (.)Vo(2)max in children who have spina bifida and are ambulatory, validating the use of a treadmill test for these children. When confirmation of maximal effort is needed, the addition of supramaximal testing of children with disability is an easy and well-tolerated method.

pred_answer: The feasibility rate for miniTAPP was 100%. The incidence of mini-TAPP-related complications was low. MiniTAPP is a safe and feasible technique for the repair of inguinal hernias.
gold_answer: While limited by its retrospective design, the present study indicates that the minilaparoscopic approach to groin hernia repair is safe and effective, making miniTAPP a challenging alternative to laparoscopy in the approach to groin hernia repair.

pred_answer: No. The decrease in length of stay for selected diagnostic categories did not appear to be associated with increased readmission rates or mean number of physician visits after discharge.
gold_answer: Improving hospital efficiency by shortening length of stay does not appear to result in increased rates of readmission or numbers of physician visits within 30 days after discharge from hospital. Research is needed to identify optimal lengths of stay and expected readmission rates.

pred_answer: No. Patients with nonpsychotic BDD and psychotic BDD did not differ significantly on most variables examined. The finding of a higher rate of lifetime DSM-III-R psychotic disorder diagnoses among patients with psychotic BDD suggests that psychotic BDD may be a variant of delusional disorder, somatic type.
gold_answer: Body dysmorphic disorder may have a closely related psychotic subtype that significantly overlaps with, or may even be the same disorder as, the BDD variant of delusional disorder, somatic type. Inclusion of a psychotic subtype for BDD should be considered for future editions of DSM.

pred_answer: Combined modality treatment can improve the survival of patients with NPC with lung metastasis alone. Patients with DFI>1 year may benefit more from combined therapy.
gold_answer: Age ≤ 45 years, DFI>1 year, and the combined therapy were good prognostic factors for NPC patients with lung metastasis(es) alone. The combination of local therapy and the basic chemotherapy should be considered for these patients with DFI>1 year.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of this study suggest that routine offering of influenza vaccination in office-based settings could reduce racial and ethnic disparities in influenza vaccination.
gold_answer: Improved office-based practices regarding influenza vaccination could significantly impact Healthy People 2020 goals by increasing influenza vaccine uptake and reducing corresponding racial and ethnic disparities.

pred_answer: The results of our study suggest that MPV may be a useful marker in the diagnosis of PID.
gold_answer: Since the MPV value was significantly decreased in patients with PID, it may serve as an additional and even more valuable marker than leukocyte count in the diagnosis of PID.

pred_answer: Our findings suggest that high-IQ schizophrenia patients may represent a clinically distinct subgroup characterised by a more benign course and less severe negative symptoms. This finding has important implications for the understanding of the pathophysiology of schizophrenia and for clinical practice.
gold_answer: These findings provide evidence for the existence of a high-IQ variant of schizophrenia that is associated with markedly fewer negative symptoms than typical schizophrenia, and lends support to the idea of a psychosis spectrum or continuum over boundaried diagnostic categories.

pred_answer: Yes. Our study suggests that ultrasonographic screening for primary hepatocellular carcinoma improves the prognosis of patients.
gold_answer: The significant impact of ultrasonographic screening on mortality reduction was demonstrated. These findings strongly suggest that early detection of hepatocellular carcinoma by ultrasound may improve the prognosis of patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.

pred_answer: No. Low birth weight is not a risk indicator for congenital cytomegalovirus infection.
gold_answer: CMV-IgM and IgG antibodies assessment was not a potential discriminative test to identify congenitally infected newborns. In addition, low birth weight and small head circumference at birth failed to predict congenital CMV infection. CMV-DNA detection in umbilical cord blood at the time of delivery using real-time PCR of all newborns is recommended as decisive, rapid and non-invasive test.

pred_answer: The RAQ was developed to measure attitudes toward recovery. The RKI was developed to measure recovery outcomes. Both were used in a study of 103 people with mental illness living in southeastern Australia. The RAQ was found to have poor psychometric properties. The RKI had good psychometric properties. The RA
gold_answer: This paper discusses the cultural appropriateness of the RAQ in Australian settings, and identifies the need to develop rigorous, inclusive recovery outcome measures.

pred_answer: No. The differences between Landolt C and Snellen E acuity are small.
gold_answer: Using the charts described, there was only a slight overestimation of visual acuity by the Snellen E compared to the Landolt C, even in strabismus amblyopia. Small differences in the lower visual acuity range have to be considered.

pred_answer: The distal ureteral diameter and its ratio to the vertebral body distance can predict the success of endoscopic injection in children with primary VUR.
gold_answer: UDR provides an objective measurement of VUR and appears as a predictive tool of success after endoscopic injection.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that the slow intravenous infusion of metoclopramide over 15 min is more effective than the rapid intravenous bolus infusion of metoclopramide over 2 min in the treatment of vascular type headache. The slow intravenous infusion of metoclopramide over
gold_answer: Slowing the infusion rate of metoclopramide is an effective strategy for the improvement of headache and reducing the incidence of akathisia in patients with vascular type headache.

pred_answer: No. Manuscripts containing citations to the reviewer's work did not receive higher scores than those without such citations.
gold_answer: In a leading specialty journal, cited reviewers gave higher scores than noncited reviewers. However, this was likely due to their being assigned higher-quality manuscripts and not because they were cited in the manuscript. Reviewer requests that their work be cited were rare.

pred_answer: No. Patients who travel long distances to high-volume centers have better outcomes than those who receive care at local, low-volume centers.
gold_answer: Our results indicate that when controlled for patient, tumor, and hospital factors, patients who traveled a long distance to a high-volume center had improved lymph node yield, neoadjuvant chemoradiation receipt, and 30- and 90-day mortality compared with those who traveled a short distance to a low-volume center. They also had improved 5-year survival. See Video Abstract at http://links.lww.com/DCR/A446.

pred_answer: No. The majority of patients with SBA develop cholestasis, but it is usually mild and transient. In-depth investigations are rarely required.
gold_answer: Small bowel atresia is frequently associated with postoperative cholestasis that will resolve with time. We recommend a more selective and expectant approach to SBA-associated cholestasis to minimize unnecessary investigations.

pred_answer: The present study suggests that aneurysm repair is feasible for the elderly patients with aSAH.
gold_answer: Better prognosis was obtained when ruptured aneurysm was repaired in the elderly than it was treated conservatively. From the results of this study, we should not hesitate to offer the definitive surgery for the elderly with aSAH.

pred_answer: CPAP therapy in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and obstructive sleep apnea offers a better quality of life and sleep.
gold_answer: Effective CPAP treatment in IPF patients with OSA results in a significant improvement in daily living activities based on the FOSQ, namely an OSA-specific follow-up instrument. Improvement was also noted in other questionnaires assessing quality of life, though not to a statistically significant degree, probably because of the multifactorial influences of IPF on physical and mental health. The probability of poor CPAP compliance was high and could only be eliminated with intense follow-up by the CPAP clinic staff.

pred_answer: The decrease in anterior chamber depth in pseudoexfoliation syndrome when facing down is significantly greater than in the fellow eyes. This suggests that the increased lens mobility in pseudoexfoliation syndrome may influence anterior chamber depth.
gold_answer: In patients with clinically apparent unilateral pseudoexfoliation, the lens seems to be more mobile in the affected eye. This results in a shallower anterior chamber when the head is placed in a prone position. Whether this fact might potentially lead to transient pupillary block when engaging in activities such as facing down while reading warrants further study.

pred_answer: Yes. Weekend AMI patients are significantly less likely to receive immediate intensive cardiac procedures, and experience significantly higher rates of adverse health outcomes.
gold_answer: Weekend hospitalization leads to delayed provision of intensive procedures and elevated 1-year mortality for elderly AMI patients. The existence of measurable differences in treatments raises questions regarding the efficacy of a single input regulation (e.g., mandated nurse staffing ratios) in enhancing the quality of weekend care. My results suggest that targeted financial incentives might be a more cost-effective policy response than broad regulation aimed at improving quality.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: In our study, it was observed that although longer ETA was associated with longer hospitalization, ETA was not correlated with postoperative complications. Our results inclined toward the position that appendectomy can be performed as a semielective surgery.

pred_answer: Yes. The reliability of PRO data captured via FTE-dependent versus non-FTE-dependent methodologies is comparable.
gold_answer: Our study suggests that there is great reliability between PRO data captured between FTE-dependent and non-FTE-dependent methodologies.

pred_answer: No. The low prevalence of PVL-positive MSSA in our study suggests that PVL is not a major determinant of the pathogenesis of primary bacteraemia caused by S. aureus.
gold_answer: We found that 1.6% of S. aureus (all MSSA) from bacteraemic patients were PVL-positive. This low incidence suggests that PVL-positive S. aureus are of no particular significance as causative agents of S. aureus bacteraemia.

pred_answer: Preoperative statin therapy reduces the incidence of postoperative AF after CABG.
gold_answer: Our study indicated that preoperative statin therapy seems to reduce AF development after CABG.

pred_answer: We found that knowledge of US-EFW within 1 month of delivery was associated with an increased risk of CD. This finding suggests that US-EFW may be a modifiable risk factor for CD.
gold_answer: Knowledge of US-EFW, above and beyond the impact of fetal size itself, increases the risk of CD. Acquisition of US-EFW near term appears to be an independent and potentially modifiable risk factor for CD.

pred_answer: Yes. Optical diagnosis of diminutive colonic polyps can be used to accurately predict appropriate colonoscopy surveillance intervals.
gold_answer: Endoscopists within a tertiary care setting can accurately predict diminutive polyp histology and confer an appropriate surveillance interval with an associated financial benefit to the healthcare system. However, limitations to its application in the community setting exist, which may improve with further training and high-definition colonoscopes.

pred_answer: No. Outcome feedback is not currently a component of EM training programs in Canada. Residents believe that outcome feedback is an important part of deliberate practice, but it is not currently being used.
gold_answer: While Canadian EM training programs do not mandate follow-up, it is performed electively by the majority of residents surveyed. Residents place a significantly greater educational value on outcome feedback than their program directors, and believe that follow-up should be a mandatory component of EM residencies.

pred_answer: No. The GI clinic patients received more information about the procedure and were more satisfied with their procedure. However, the GI clinic patients were more likely to receive their endoscopic results from a gastroenterologist rather than the referring physician.
gold_answer: Patients undergoing open access procedures are less likely to be properly informed about their endoscopic procedure. Our results indicate that with open access endoscopy, a defined mechanism needs to be in place for communication of endoscopic results to the patient.

pred_answer: Yes. The findings suggest that dementia and aphasia may be more common than previously recognised in MND. The presence of these deficits should be considered when assessing patients with MND.
gold_answer: The prevalence of cognitive impairment in MND in this population based study of an unselected cohort was higher than has been previously reported. Language deficits, especially anomia, may be relatively frequent in the MND population. Aphasia in MND may be masked by dysarthria and missed if not specifically examined.

pred_answer: Unanswerable
gold_answer: No change occurred upon instituting simple, at-the-visit family history prompts geared to improve PCPs' ability to identify patients at high risk for 6 common conditions. The results are both surprising and disappointing. Further studies should examine physicians' perception of the utility of prompts for family history risk.

pred_answer: The frequency of hepatitis G virus infection in cryptogenic chronic liver disease is similar to that in hepatitis C virus-related chronic liver disease. The presence of hepatitis G virus infection does not seem to be associated with severe liver damage. TT virus infection is rare in cryptogenic chronic liver disease.
gold_answer: In Southern Italy, hepatitis G virus infection is widespread among patients with chronic hepatitis, independently of parenteral risk factors. Its frequency in subjects with cryptogenic liver disease parallels that observed in hepatitis C virus chronic liver disease, thus ruling out an aetiologic role of hepatitis G virus. TT virus infection is uncommon in patients with cryptogenic or hepatitis C virus-related liver disease who do not have a history of parenteral exposure.

pred_answer: The present study suggests that cytoplasmic overexpression of β-catenin may play a role in the pathogenesis of SbCC. The presence of cytoplasmic overexpression of β-catenin in SbCC may be an important prognostic factor.
gold_answer: Cytoplasmic overexpression of β-catenin was observed in the majority of the cases of SbCC of eyelid, and this correlated significantly with tumour size. The authors therefore hypothesise that β-catenin overexpression in SbCC of eyelid may be a result of Wnt/β-catenin pathway dysregulation. However, its role both in the development of sebaceous cell carcinoma of the eyelid as well as its prognosis needs to be explored further.

pred_answer: Yes. EMS providers can provide appropriate tidal volumes in a simulated adult-sized patient with a pediatric-sized bag-valve-mask.
gold_answer: The study suggests that ventilating an adult patient is possible with a smaller, pediatric-sized BVM. The tidal volumes recorded with the pediatric BVM were more consistent with lung-protective ventilation volumes.

pred_answer: Yes. The results of this study show that communication with terminally ill patients can be taught.
gold_answer: The realized communication skills courses resulted in relevant changes in communication behaviour and self-confidence of participants. Communication with terminally ill patients can be taught.

pred_answer: Trabecular bone is related to primary stability of miniscrews. Trabecular bone quality should be considered when planning the use of miniscrews.
gold_answer: Cancellous bone plays an important role in primary stability of mini-implants in the presence or absence of cortical bone.

pred_answer: EDWS is a safe and effective method for the treatment of portal hypertension.
gold_answer: EDWS is a safe and effective treatment for esophagogastric varices secondary to portal hypertension in selected patients. Patients treated with EDWS had a lower complication rate of portal venous system thrombosis compared with those treated with conventional MED.

pred_answer: No. Oblique views did not improve the sensitivity or specificity of the diagnosis of spondylolysis in adolescents.
gold_answer: There is no difference in sensitivity and specificity between four-view and two-view studies. Although oblique views have long been considered standard practice by some, our data could not identify a diagnostic benefit that might outweigh the additional cost and radiation exposure.

pred_answer: Yes. Our findings suggest that Ki-67 expression is a useful biomarker for predicting the prognosis of UTUC patients.
gold_answer: In conclusion, high Ki-67 expression was associated with poor survival in patients with UTUC, as well as a high risk of disease progression, although these findings need to be interpreted with caution. Large-scale, adequately designed, prospective trials are needed to further confirm the value of Ki-67 in prognosis of UTUC patients.

pred_answer: Yes. Patients with SMI are more likely to be admitted to nursing homes with more deficiencies in care. This may reflect the need for more psychiatric care in these patients, but also suggests that nursing homes may be less willing to admit them.
gold_answer: Patients diagnosed with schizophrenia or bipolar disorder (ie, SMI) were more likely than other patients to be admitted to nursing homes with higher deficiency citations for both overall quality and clinical care quality. Further research is necessary to understand the reasons behind the disparity in quality of nursing home care associated with SMI.

pred_answer: The use of lumbar drainage of postoperative cerebrospinal fluid fistula after spine surgery is effective.
gold_answer: Lumbar drainage seems to be effective and safe both in preventing CSF fistula in cases of large dural tears and debilitated/irradiated patients and in treating CSF leaks.

pred_answer: The present study demonstrated that LAA occlusion device could induce a slight and measureable movement of QRS electric axis and prolong the mean-mean QT interval in patients with AF. The LA diameter and ARD were larger during follow-up at 6 and 12months than the baseline dimension in pre-operation.
gold_answer: LAA occlusion device resulted in a slightly movement in QRS axis, reduced HR and increased the mean-mean QT interval duration. In addition, LA diameter and ARD seemed to be larger after device implantation.

pred_answer: Unanswerable.
gold_answer: Despite the positive effects the 80-hour workweek has had on resident quality of life and patient care, it does not seem that either significant improvements or detrimental effects have occurred on surgical education within residency programs in New England.

pred_answer: No. Patients who experienced severe pain immediately after vertebroplasty had similar pain scores and analgesic usage at 1 month and 1 year postprocedure compared with those who did not experience severe pain.
gold_answer: Patients with severe pain immediately after vertebroplasty have similar long-term outcomes compared with patients without severe pain.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that epiDWI can be used to differentiate between pleomorphic adenomas and other primary parotid gland tumors. However, it is not possible to distinguish between Warthin tumors and mucoepidermoid carcinomas, acinic cell carcinomas, and basal cell adenocarcin
gold_answer: epiDWI has the potential to differentiate pleomorphic adenoma and myoepithelial adenomas from all other examined entities. Due to an overlap not only within the group of benign and malignant lesions but also between groups, diagnoses should not be addressed on the basis of ADC values solely. Therefore, further studies combining DWI, morphologic criteria, and probably other MR imaging techniques seem warranted.

pred_answer: The case presented here suggests that external radiotherapy can be an effective palliative treatment for gallbladder carcinoma.
gold_answer: External radiotherapy seems to be a safe and effective method of palliative management of gallbladder carcinoma. However, further studies are necessary to determine the role of radiotherapy in palliative or adjuvant treatment of gallbladder carcinoma.

pred_answer: Our results suggest that beta E deficiency may contribute to the development of anxiety during alcohol withdrawal.
gold_answer: Our results give first evidence that lowered beta E during alcohol withdrawal may contribute to anxiety as a common disturbance during this state.

pred_answer: No. Central venous pressure is not a useful predictor of fluid responsiveness.
gold_answer: There are no data to support the widespread practice of using central venous pressure to guide fluid therapy. This approach to fluid resuscitation should be abandoned.

pred_answer: Yes. CIMT was significantly different among the three cardiovascular phenotypes and correlated significantly with traditional cardiovascular risk factors.
gold_answer: Our findings support CIMT as a significant indicator of both cardiovascular risk and phenotype among adult black Africans. However, specific thresholds need to be defined based on prospective studies.

pred_answer: No. The majority of patients with localized prostate cancer prefer less aggressive treatment. This choice is highly consistent and is related to the importance assigned to the probability of survival, cure and late genitourinary and gastrointestinal adverse effects.
gold_answer: Most patients with localized prostate cancer prefer the lower radiation dose. Our findings indicate that many patients attach more weight to specific quality-of-life aspects (eg, GI toxicity) than to improving survival. Treatment preferences of patients with localized prostate cancer can and should be involved in radiotherapy decision making.

pred_answer: In HIV-infected patients, the prevalence of SMI detected by myocardial SPECT is high in men older than 52 years with at least two other CRFs. This suggests that these patients should be screened for SMI using myocardial SPECT.
gold_answer: In male HIV-infected patients older than 52 years and with at least two other CRFs, screening for SMI using myocardial SPECT was about four times more likely to be positive than in the general population. This may motivate physicians to advise these patients to undergo more systematic screening for SMI using this technique.

pred_answer: The present study showed that the lifetime prevalence of IC was significantly higher in children with AD than in those without AD. However, the prevalence of MC and HI did not differ between AD and non-AD children. These results suggest that IC may be associated with AD, while MC and HI are not.
gold_answer: The lifetime prevalence of IC was indeed higher in young children with a history of AD.

pred_answer: The present study demonstrates that alcohol-associated cues can activate alcohol-seeking behaviour in rats trained to self-administer alcohol. This effect is blocked by naltrexone and is not dependent on prior withdrawal or relapse. These results suggest that alcohol-associated cues can activate alcohol-seeking behaviour in rats and that this effect can be blocked by
gold_answer: Cue-induced behavioural activation was specific to alcohol cues, reproducible, persistent and could be blocked by naltrexone, and its correlation with human self-report of craving makes it a potentially useful model for studying alcohol craving.

pred_answer: Yes. Partial remission is a risk factor for relapse in a 4-year follow up.
gold_answer: At medium term, relapse rates for a major depressive episode are high. Partial remission after a depressive episode seems to be an important predictive factor for relapses in a 4-year follow-up.

pred_answer: Sternal plating improves sternal stability in a human cadaver model.
gold_answer: Transverse sternal plating with 1 or 4 plates significantly improves sternal stability closure in human cadaver model. Adding a single sternal plate to primary closure improves the strength of sternal closure with traditional wiring potentially reducing the risk of sternal dehiscence and could be considered in high risk patients.

pred_answer: No. PRISM scores have a weak correlation with LOS. An ANN model based on PRISM scores does not improve prediction accuracy.
gold_answer: The ANN with its intrinsic ability to detect non-linear correlation, and to relate specific item patterns to LOS, outperformed linear statistics but was still disappointing in estimating individual LOS. It might be speculated that therapeutic intervention modulates the natural course of the disease thus counteracting both disease severity as initially scored by PRISM, and LOS. This being true, the inverse of the correlation between PRISM (or PRISM based LOS estimate) and LOS might be a candidate indicator of quality of care.

pred_answer: The study shows that cytokines are present in the serum of patients with epilepsy and new onset seizures. The levels of cytokines are higher in patients with SE and those with a longer history of epilepsy. The levels of cytokines decrease during the seizure-free period. This suggests that cytokines may play a role in the path
gold_answer: We found increased post-ictal serum cytokine levels in patients with several epilepsy syndromes.

pred_answer: A swirling pattern of epithelial cells may be useful in distinguishing PBD from NPBD. However, this finding alone is not sufficient to diagnose PBD.
gold_answer: Because there is significant overlap in cytologic features between NPBD and PBD, the distinction between the two entities is difficult in cytologic sampling.

pred_answer: Prophylactic fixation of the uninjured hip is not cost-effective in the majority of patients. However, it may be cost-effective in some older women if the relative risk of a contralateral hip fracture is increased and the additional costs of the procedure are low.
gold_answer: : Prophylactic fixation with a cephalomedullary nail was not found to be cost-effective for the average older woman who sustained a hip fracture. However, it may be appropriate for select patient populations. The study supports the need for basic science and clinical trials investigating the effectiveness of prophylactic fixation for patient populations at higher lifetime risk for contralateral hip fracture.

pred_answer: Socioeconomic differences in mortality persist after retirement. Employment grade and car ownership are independent predictors of mortality after retirement.
gold_answer: Socioeconomic differences in mortality persist beyond retirement age and in magnitude increase with age. Social differentials in mortality based on an occupational status measure seem to decrease to a greater degree after retirement than those based on a non-work measure. This suggests that alongside other socioeconomic factors work itself may play an important part in generating social inequalities in health in men of working age.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that pulpotomy with MTA can be considered a viable alternative to root canal treatment in the management of immature teeth with vital pulps and without clinical evidence of irreversible pulpitis.
gold_answer: Under the conditions of this study, pulpotomy offered a viable alternative to root canal treatment for teeth with vital pulps in the short term. However, there is insufficient clinical evidence to consider this technique for the treatment of every permanent tooth. Nevertheless, it should be considered as a potential alternative approach to be further developed for future applications.

pred_answer: In children with malignancy and ARDS, early respiratory parameters can predict outcome.
gold_answer: Peak inspiratory pressure, PEEP, and ventilation index values could distinguish survivors from nonsurvivors by day 3. This may assist in early application of supportive nonconventional therapies in children with malignancy and ARDS.

pred_answer: No. DT and NCCT have similar stone detection rates in terms of stone counts and stone area.
gold_answer: We found DT to be a comparable imaging modality to NCCT for the detection of intrarenal stones, without a significant effect from stone size and BMI and adequate reproducibility between multiple readers. DT appears to be an ideal alternative for following patients with nephrolithiasis due to its acceptable stone detection rates, low radiation exposure, and decreased cost compared to NCCT.

pred_answer: No. The presence of onsite revascularization services did not influence the prognosis of elderly patients with acute myocardial infarction complicated by cardiogenic shock.
gold_answer: In a community-based cohort, patients with acute myocardial infarction complicated by cardiogenic shock did not have significantly different adjusted 30-day and 1-year mortality, irrespective of the revascularization capabilities of the admitting hospital.

pred_answer: Yes. The differences between the three methods of measuring BP are clinically important.
gold_answer: Systolic BP measured by the nurse in treated hypertensive patients is significantly lower than the readings obtained by the physician, and are almost identical to ambulatory BP monitoring. Blood pressure determination by the nurse is desirable not only for diagnosis but also to evaluate the level of control of blood pressure during the follow-up of treated hypertensive patients.

pred_answer: Socioeconomic status was associated with acceptance of preventive home visits, but the association was modified by the municipality's invitational procedures.
gold_answer: High socioeconomic status was associated with a higher acceptance rate of preventive home visits, but the association was attenuated by invitational procedures. The results indicate that the social inequality in acceptance of publicly offered preventive services might decrease if municipalities adopt more proactive invitational procedures.

gold_answer: There is no advantage to an intramedullary nail versus a sliding compression hip screw for low-energy pertrochanteric fractures AO/OTA 31-A1 and A2, specifically with its increased cost and lack of evidence to show decreased complications or improved patient outcome.

pred_answer: The results suggest that reducing spasticity may improve arm function. However, the relationship between the two variables is complex and further research is required to determine whether this is a causal relationship.
gold_answer: Using a targeted meta-analytic approach, it is possible to demonstrate that reducing spasticity in the arm is associated with a significant improvement in arm function.

pred_answer: Yes. Resistance rates to ofloxacin in women aged 56-75 years exceeded 10%, suggesting that fluoroquinolones should not be used for empiric treatment of uncomplicated UTI in this age group.
gold_answer: Physicians who opt to treat UTI in postmenopausal women empirically should consider prescribing drugs other than fluoroquinolones. Concomitant longitudinal surveillance of both antibiotic utilization patterns and uropathogen resistance rates should become routine practice in this managed-care organization.

gold_answer: The signal intensity on DWI showed no significant difference in the development of vascularization.

pred_answer: Age at orchiopexy did not affect testicular atrophy. However, intraabdominal testes had a significantly higher risk of atrophy.
gold_answer: From this study we conclude that there is no increase in testicular atrophy in patients less than 13 months.

pred_answer: The results of the present study suggest that the ACMIA method can be used as an alternative to the MEIA method for blood tacrolimus assays.
gold_answer: The ACMIA method used for a tacrolimus assay is precise and has advantages, including the lack of a required pretreatment procedure. Furthermore, it is only slightly influenced by the hematologic or biochemical status of the samples.

pred_answer: No. Early surfactant administration did not reduce the incidence of CLD or mortality in premature infants.
gold_answer: Early surfactant administration is associated with shorter duration of ventilation but does not appear to be significantly protective against CLD/mortality among premature infants. This may support the growing evidence for consideration of CPAP as an alternative to routine intubation and early surfactant administration. Further investigation from large randomized clinical trials is warranted to confirm these results.

pred_answer: No. The use of PET/CT did not improve the accuracy of the preoperative staging of patients with liver metastases of colorectal carcinoma.
gold_answer: PET/CT has a limited role in hepatic staging of LMCRC. Although PET-CT has higher sensitivity for the detection of extrahepatic disease in some anatomic locations, its results are hampered by its low PPV. PET/CT provided additional useful information in 8% of the cases but also incorrect and potentially harmful data in 9% of the staging. Our findings support a more selective use of PET/CT, basically in patients with high risk of local recurrence.

pred_answer: No. The in-flight environment of air medical transport in a BO-105 helicopter does not impair the ability of flight nurses to perform oral endotracheal intubation.
gold_answer: Oral endotracheal intubation in the in-flight setting of the BO-105 helicopter takes approximately twice as long as intubation in a ground setting. The results support pre-flight intubation of patients who appear likely to require urgent intubation during air medical transport in the BO-105 helicopter.

pred_answer: No. Decompressive surgery did not improve the prognosis of spinal cord sarcoidosis accompanied with compressive cervical myelopathy.
gold_answer: The effect of decompression for spinal cord sarcoidosis with compressive myelopathy was not evident. Early diagnosis for sarcoidosis from other organ and steroid therapy should be needed.

pred_answer: The identification of women with depression in pregnancy is difficult when using routine health data. The use of multiple data sources provides a more complete picture of the problem.
gold_answer: No single data source is likely to provide a complete health profile for an individual. For women with depression in pregnancy and dispensed antidepressants, the hospital admission data do not adequately capture all cases.

pred_answer: Epinephrine is not necessary during SAPO.
gold_answer: The addition of epinephrine to ACLS-SAPO increases vital organ perfusion pressures and improves outcome from cardiac arrest. There appears to be a profound loss of arterial vasomotor tone after prolonged arrest. This loss of vasomotor tone may make exogenous pressors necessary for resuscitation after prolonged cardiac arrest.

pred_answer: No. The call for boycott by the Catholic bishops did not affect the polio vaccination coverage in Kenya in 2015. The proportion of children who were not vaccinated due to parent's refusal significantly increased from 6% to 12% in August 2015.
gold_answer: The call for boycott did not affect the campaign significantly. However, if the call for boycott is repeated in future it could have some significant negative implication to polio eradication. It is therefore important to ensure that any vaccine safety issues are addressed accordingly.

pred_answer: Dexamethasone appears to be an effective alternative to oral prednisone in the treatment of pediatric asthma exacerbations. Dexamethasone may have advantages over prednisone, including improved compliance and less vomiting.
gold_answer: The current literature suggests that dexamethasone can be used as an effective alternative to prednisone in the treatment of mild to moderate acute asthma exacerbations in children, with the added benefits of improved compliance, palatability, and cost. However, more research is needed to examine the role of dexamethasone in hospitalized children.

pred_answer: No. Fetal thrombocytopenia is more common in pregnancies complicated by RhD alloimmunization than by Kell alloimmunization.
gold_answer: In contrast to fetuses with severe anaemia and hydrops due to RhD alloimmunization, fetuses with severe anaemia due to Kell alloimmunization are generally not at risk for substantial thrombocytopenia.

gold_answer: The frequency of habits of Chaalia and Pan Masala chewing, by school children in lower socio-economic areas is extremely high. The probable reasons for this high frequency are taste, the widespread use of these substances by family members and friends, low cost and easy availability.

gold_answer: Ongoing RCTs may lack enough power to settle the issue of whether or not the transfusion of stored blood has a negative clinical impact. A precautionary reduction of the maximum storage time to 35 days is advisable.

pred_answer: Yes. The results suggest that the SSI program reduces disability among the elderly.
gold_answer: Income support policy may be a significant new lever for improving population health, especially that of lower-income persons. Even though the findings are robust, further analyses are needed to confirm their reliability. Future research should examine a variety of different income support policies, as well as whether a broader range of social and economic policies affect health.

However, the lack of correlation between CML and pentosidine or MDA-lysine levels indicates
gold_answer: These data suggest that the increased levels of AGEs in blood, and probably in tissues, reported in uremia implicate a broad derangement in non-enzymatic biochemistry involving alterations in autoxidation of both carbohydrates and lipids.

pred_answer: Yes. The OraQuick® HIV-1/2 Assay in sputum specimens can be used as a valid tool for HIV surveillance among TB patients.
gold_answer: This testing method may provide a useful strategy for conducting HIV surveillance in possible co-infected TB patients at peripheral centres. Since there is no investment on infrastructure, it may be possible for paramedical health professionals to carry out the test, particularly in areas with low HIV endemicity.

pred_answer: The height of the lower calyceal infundibulum may be an important factor in predicting the clearance of lower calyceal stones after SWL.
gold_answer: Lower Infundibular height could be a good measurement tool for deciding which patients with lower calyceal lithiasis would benefit from SWL treatment. Height of less than 22 mm suggests a good outcome from lithotripsy.

pred_answer: Yes. Defecatory symptoms are significantly more common in women with pelvic pain than those without pain.
gold_answer: In women with POP, the symptom of pelvic pain is associated with the presence of defecatory symptoms.

pred_answer: The current guidelines for hospital preparedness for HMCI are not adequate for predicting the actual casualty load and the need for immediate medical treatment.
gold_answer: Hospital preparedness can be better defined by a fixed number of casualties rather than a percentile of its bed capacity. Only 20% of the arriving casualties will require immediate medical treatment. Implementation of this concept may improve the utilisation of national emergency health resources both in the preparation phase and on real time.

pred_answer: Sonographic needle guidance improves the clinical outcome of IA injections.
gold_answer: Sonographic needle guidance significantly improves the performance and outcomes of outpatient IA injections in a clinically significant manner.

pred_answer: The results of this study suggest that past group A streptococcal infection may play a role in the pathogenesis of MS.
gold_answer: These findings indicate that a relationship between multiple sclerosis and streptococcal infections may exist, but to acquire a better understanding of the role of group A streptococci in the pathogenesis of multiple sclerosis, more studies with animal models are necessary.

pred_answer: The findings suggest that men's attitudes towards breast cancer are complex and multifaceted. Men's willingness to support their wives in seeking breast health care is tempered by their own concerns about the impact of breast cancer on their own lives and their families. These findings have implications for the development of interventions aimed at increasing men's involvement
gold_answer: Jordanian men perceive themselves as having a vital role in supporting, guiding and encouraging their wives to follow breast cancer early detection recommendations. Breast health awareness campaigns could involve husbands to capitalize on family support.

pred_answer: The present study shows that the activation of AMPK by metformin and AICAR affects the circadian rhythm of melatonin secretion in ewes. This effect may be mediated by the regulation of the secretion of insulin. The results suggest that AMPK is involved in the regulation of the circadian rhythm of melatonin
gold_answer: Taken together, these results suggest a potential role for AMPK on the secretion of melatonin probably acting trough the paraventricular nucleus and/or directly in the pineal gland. We conclude that AMPK may act as a metabolic cue to modulate the rhythm of melatonin secretion.

pred_answer: Yes. Fetal anatomic assessment on follow-up antepartum sonograms can identify unanticipated fetal anomalies that may require neonatal intervention.
gold_answer: A fetal anatomic survey on follow-up sonograms may identify unanticipated fetal anomalies, especially when the indication is for fetal growth.

pred_answer: No. The addition of BM to GM does not reduce the cochlear toxicity of GM.
gold_answer: Our data suggest that hearing loss caused by GM otic drops may be reduced by the inclusion of BM and benzalkonium chloride. Our finding that BM alone was associated with hearing loss suggests that the benzalkonium chloride may be the protective agent in combination otic drops.

pred_answer: Yes. Infectious disease specialists have good validity and reliability when assessing the appropriateness of antimicrobial prescribing.
gold_answer: Doctors specialized in infectious diseases and clinical microbiology assess the appropriateness of antimicrobials prescribed for a broad spectrum of indications with acceptable agreement and validity, regardless of their experience or hospital of employment. However, there is room for improvement, which merits attention in multidisciplinary discussions and education.
